<li id="pt-login-2" class="user-links-collapsible-item mw-list-item user-links-collapsible-item"><a data-mw="interface" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:UserLogin&amp;returnto=Lionel+Messi" title="You&#39;re encouraged to log in; however, it&#39;s not mandatory. [ctrl-option-o]" accesskey="o" class=""><span>Log in</span></a>
</li>

			
		</ul>
		
	</div>
</div>

	</div>

	</label>
	<div class="vector-dropdown-content">

	<div class="vector-menu-content">

					<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading mw-first-heading"><span class="mw-page-title-main">Lionel Messi</span></h1>
							
<div id="p-lang-btn" class="vector-dropdown mw-portlet mw-portlet-lang">
	<input type="checkbox" id="p-lang-btn-checkbox" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" data-event-name="ui.dropdown-p-lang-btn" class="vector-dropdown-checkbox mw-interlanguage-selector" aria-label="Go to an article in another language. Available in 183 languages">

					<div id="contentSub"><div id="mw-content-subtitle"><span class="mw-redirectedfrom">(Redirected from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lionel_messi&amp;redirect=no" class="mw-redirect" title="Lionel messi">Lionel messi</a>)</span></div></div>
					
					
					<div id="mw-content-text" class="mw-body-content"><div class="mw-content-ltr mw-parser-output" lang="en" dir="ltr"><div class="shortdescription nomobile noexcerpt noprint searchaux" style="display:none">Argentine footballer (born 1987)</div>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1236090951">.mw-parser-output .hatnote{font-style:italic}.mw-parser-output div.hatnote{padding-left:1.6em;margin-bottom:0.5em}.mw-parser-output .hatnote i{font-style:normal}.mw-parser-output .hatnote+link+.hatnote{margin-top:-0.5em}@media print{body.ns-0 .mw-parser-output .hatnote{display:none!important}}</style><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">"Messi" redirects here. For other uses, see <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messi_(disambiguation)" class="mw-disambig" title="Messi (disambiguation)">Messi (disambiguation)</a>.</div>
<p class="mw-empty-elt">



</p>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1289430074">.mw-parser-output .infobox-subbox{padding:0;border:none;margin:-3px;width:auto;min-width:100%;font-size:100%;clear:none;float:none;background-color:transparent}.mw-parser-output .infobox-3cols-child{margin:auto}.mw-parser-output .infobox .navbar{font-size:100%}@media screen{html.skin-theme-clientpref-night .mw-parser-output .infobox-full-data:not(.notheme)>div:not(.notheme)[style]{background:#1f1f23!important;color:#f8f9fa}}@media screen and (prefers-color-scheme:dark){html.skin-theme-clientpref-os .mw-parser-output .infobox-full-data:not(.notheme) div:not(.notheme){background:#1f1f23!important;color:#f8f9fa}}@media(min-width:640px){body.skin--responsive .mw-parser-output .infobox-table{display:table!important}body.skin--responsive .mw-parser-output .infobox-table>caption{display:table-caption!important}body.skin--responsive .mw-parser-output .infobox-table>tbody{display:table-row-group}body.skin--responsive .mw-parser-output .infobox-table th,body.skin--responsive .mw-parser-output .infobox-table td{padding-left:inherit;padding-right:inherit}}</style><table class="infobox infobox-table vcard" style="line-height: 1.2em; max-width: 420px !important;"><caption class="infobox-title fn" style="line-height: 1.2em; font-size: 125%">Lionel Messi</caption><tbody><tr><td colspan="4" class="infobox-image">

<td style="background: #9acdff; vertical-align:middle; padding:5px;"><span class="mw-image-border" typeof="mw:File"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lionel_Messi_20180626_(3x4_cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img alt="Lionel Messi" src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/Lionel_Messi_20180626_(3x4_cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="90" height="120" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a1/Lionel_Messi_20180626_%283x4_cropped%29.jpg/250px-Lionel_Messi_20180626_%283x4_cropped%29.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="471" data-file-height="626"></a></span></td>

</tr><tr><td class="sidebar-navbar" style="text-align:center;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1129693374"><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1239400231">.mw-parser-output .navbar{display:inline;font-size:88%;font-weight:normal}.mw-parser-output .navbar-collapse{float:left;text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .navbar-boxtext{word-spacing:0}.mw-parser-output .navbar ul{display:inline-block;white-space:nowrap;line-height:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-brackets::before{margin-right:-0.125em;content:"[ "}.mw-parser-output .navbar-brackets::after{margin-left:-0.125em;content:" ]"}.mw-parser-output .navbar li{word-spacing:-0.125em}.mw-parser-output .navbar a>span,.mw-parser-output .navbar a>abbr{text-decoration:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-mini abbr{font-variant:small-caps;border-bottom:none;text-decoration:none;cursor:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-ct-full{font-size:114%;margin:0 7em}.mw-parser-output .navbar-ct-mini{font-size:114%;margin:0 4em}html.skin-theme-clientpref-night .mw-parser-output .navbar li a abbr{color:var(--color-base)!important}@media(prefers-color-scheme:dark){html.skin-theme-clientpref-os .mw-parser-output .navbar li a abbr{color:var(--color-base)!important}}@media print{.mw-parser-output .navbar{display:none!important}}</style><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Template:Lionel_Messi_series" title="Template:Lionel Messi series"><abbr title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Template_talk:Lionel_Messi_series" title="Template talk:Lionel Messi series"><abbr title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:EditPage/Template:Lionel_Messi_series" title="Special:EditPage/Template:Lionel Messi series"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p><b>Lionel Andrés</b> "<b>Leo</b>" <b>Messi</b><sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-7"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>note 1<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> (<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1177148991">.mw-parser-output .IPA-label-small{font-size:85%}.mw-parser-output .references .IPA-label-small,.mw-parser-output .infobox .IPA-label-small,.mw-parser-output .navbox .IPA-label-small{font-size:100%}</style><span class="IPA-label IPA-label-small">Spanish pronunciation:</span> <span class="IPA nowrap" lang="es-Latn-fonipa"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:IPA/Spanish" title="Help:IPA/Spanish">[ljoˈnel<span class="wrap"> </span>anˈdɾes<span class="wrap"> </span>ˈmesi]</a></span> <span class="ext-phonos"><span data-nosnippet="" id="ooui-php-1" class="noexcerpt ext-phonos-PhonosButton ext-phonos-PhonosButton-emptylabel oo-ui-widget oo-ui-widget-enabled oo-ui-buttonElement oo-ui-buttonElement-frameless oo-ui-iconElement oo-ui-buttonWidget" data-ooui="{&quot;_&quot;:&quot;mw.Phonos.PhonosButton&quot;,&quot;href&quot;:&quot;\/\/upload.wikimedia.org\/wikipedia\/commons\/transcoded\/0\/09\/Lionel_Andr%C3%A9s_Messi_-_Name.ogg\/Lionel_Andr%C3%A9s_Messi_-_Name.ogg.mp3&quot;,&quot;rel&quot;:[&quot;nofollow&quot;],&quot;framed&quot;:false,&quot;icon&quot;:&quot;volumeUp&quot;,&quot;data&quot;:{&quot;ipa&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;lang&quot;:&quot;en&quot;,&quot;wikibase&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;file&quot;:&quot;Lionel Andr\u00e9s Messi - Name.ogg&quot;},&quot;classes&quot;:[&quot;noexcerpt&quot;,&quot;ext-phonos-PhonosButton&quot;,&quot;ext-phonos-PhonosButton-emptylabel&quot;]}"><a role="button" tabindex="0" href="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/transcoded/0/09/Lionel_Andr%C3%A9s_Messi_-_Name.ogg/Lionel_Andr%C3%A9s_Messi_-_Name.ogg.mp3" rel="nofollow" aria-label="Play audio" title="Play audio" class="oo-ui-buttonElement-button"><span class="oo-ui-iconElement-icon oo-ui-icon-volumeUp"></span><span class="oo-ui-labelElement-label"></span><span class="oo-ui-indicatorElement-indicator oo-ui-indicatorElement-noIndicator"></span></a></span><sup class="ext-phonos-attribution noexcerpt navigation-not-searchable"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lionel_Andr%C3%A9s_Messi_-_Name.ogg" title="File:Lionel Andrés Messi - Name.ogg">ⓘ</a></sup></span>; born 24 June 1987) is an Argentine professional <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a> for and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain_(association_football)" title="Captain (association football)">captains</a> both <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_League_Soccer" title="Major League Soccer">Major League Soccer</a> club <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inter_Miami_CF" title="Inter Miami CF">Inter Miami</a> and the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team" title="Argentina national football team">Argentina national team</a>. Widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time, Messi set numerous records for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_career_achievements_by_Lionel_Messi#Individual_honours" title="List of career achievements by Lionel Messi">individual accolades won</a> throughout <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Career_of_Lionel_Messi" title="Career of Lionel Messi">his professional footballing career</a> such as eight <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ballon_d%27Or" title="Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a> awards and eight times being named the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Men%27s_Player#FIFA_Player_of_the_Year_(including_predecessors)" title="The Best FIFA Men&#39;s Player">world's best player</a> by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA" title="FIFA">FIFA</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-BDOFIFA_13-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-BDOFIFA-13"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>note 2<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He is the most decorated player in the history of professional football having won <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_career_achievements_by_Lionel_Messi#Collective_awards" title="List of career achievements by Lionel Messi">45 team trophies</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-2005Supercopa_24-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-2005Supercopa-24"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>note 3<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> including twelve <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Big_Five_(association_football)" title="Big Five (association football)">Big Five</a> league titles, four <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions Leagues</a>, two <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="Copa América">Copa Américas</a>, and one <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup" title="FIFA World Cup">FIFA World Cup</a>. Messi <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_career_achievements_by_Lionel_Messi#Records" title="List of career achievements by Lionel Messi">holds the records</a> for most <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Golden_Shoe" title="European Golden Shoe">European Golden Shoes</a> (6), most goals in a calendar year (91), most goals for a single club (672, with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a>), most <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_La_Liga_top_scorers#All-time_top_scorers" title="List of La Liga top scorers">goals</a> (474), <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_La_Liga_hat-tricks" title="List of La Liga hat-tricks">hat-tricks</a> (36) and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assist_(association_football)" title="Assist (association football)">assists</a> (192) in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a>, most <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_records_and_statistics#Individual_records" title="Copa América records and statistics">assists</a> (18) and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_records_and_statistics#Individual_records" title="Copa América records and statistics">goal contributions</a> (32) in the Copa América, most <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_records_and_statistics#Goal_contributions" title="FIFA World Cup records and statistics">goal contributions</a> (21) in the World Cup, most <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_men%27s_footballers_with_100_or_more_international_caps" title="List of men&#39;s footballers with 100 or more international caps">international appearances</a> (191) and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_men%27s_footballers_with_50_or_more_international_goals" title="List of men&#39;s footballers with 50 or more international goals">international goals</a> (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_international_goals_scored_by_Lionel_Messi" title="List of international goals scored by Lionel Messi">112</a>) by a South American male, and the second-most in the latter category outright. A prolific goalscorer and creative playmaker, Messi has scored over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_footballers_with_500_or_more_goals" title="List of footballers with 500 or more goals">850 senior career goals</a> and has provided over 380 assists for club and country.<sup id="cite_ref-25" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-25"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>21<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Born in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosario" title="Rosario">Rosario</a>, Argentina, Messi relocated to Spain to join Barcelona at age 13, and made his competitive debut at age 17 in October 2004. He gradually established himself as an integral player for the club, and during his first uninterrupted season at age 22 in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2008–09 FC Barcelona season">2008–09</a> he helped Barcelona achieve the first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Treble_(association_football)" title="Treble (association football)">treble</a> in Spanish football. This resulted in Messi winning the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2009_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2009 Ballon d&#39;Or">first</a> of four consecutive Ballons d'Or, and by the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2011%E2%80%9312_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2011–12 FC Barcelona season">2011–12 season</a> he would set La Liga and European records for most goals in a season and establish himself as <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_FC_Barcelona_records_and_statistics#Top_goalscorers" title="List of FC Barcelona records and statistics">Barcelona's all-time top scorer</a>. The following two seasons, he finished second for the Ballon d'Or behind <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo" title="Cristiano Ronaldo">Cristiano Ronaldo</a>, his perceived <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messi%E2%80%93Ronaldo_rivalry" title="Messi–Ronaldo rivalry">career rival</a>. However, he regained his best form during the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2014–15 FC Barcelona season">2014–15 campaign</a>, where he became the all-time top scorer in La Liga, led Barcelona to a historic second treble, and won a fifth Ballon d'Or in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2015 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">2015</a>. He assumed Barcelona's captaincy in 2018 and won a record sixth Ballon d'Or in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2019 Ballon d&#39;Or">2019</a>. During his overall tenure at Barcelona, Messi won a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_FC_Barcelona_records_and_statistics#Other_individual_records_for_the_club" title="List of FC Barcelona records and statistics">club-record</a> 34 trophies, including ten La Liga titles and four Champions Leagues, among others. Financial difficulties at Barcelona led to Messi signing with French club <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain" class="mw-redirect" title="Paris Saint-Germain">Paris Saint-Germain</a> in August 2021, where he would win the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ligue_1" title="Ligue 1">Ligue 1</a> title during both of his seasons there. He joined Major League Soccer club Inter Miami in July 2023.
</p><p>An Argentine international, Messi is the national team's <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team#Top_goalscorers" title="Argentina national football team">all-time leading goalscorer</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team#Most-capped_players" title="Argentina national football team">most-capped player</a>. His style of play as a diminutive, left-footed <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dribbling#Association_football" title="Dribbling">dribbler</a>, drew career-long comparisons with compatriot <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a>, who described Messi as <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Maradona" title="New Maradona">his successor</a>. At the youth level, he won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2005_FIFA_World_Youth_Championship" title="2005 FIFA World Youth Championship">2005 FIFA World Youth Championship</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olympic_medal" title="Olympic medal">gold medal</a> in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Football_at_the_2008_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_tournament" title="Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men&#39;s tournament">2008 Summer Olympics</a>. After his senior debut in 2005, Messi became the youngest Argentine to play and score in a World Cup in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2006_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2006 FIFA World Cup">2006</a>. Assuming captaincy in 2011, he then led Argentina to three consecutive finals in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</a>, the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2015 Copa América">2015 Copa América</a> and the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Centenario" title="Copa América Centenario">Copa América Centenario</a>, all of which they would lose. After initially announcing his international retirement in 2016, he returned to help his country narrowly qualify for the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2018 FIFA World Cup">2018 FIFA World Cup</a>, which they would exit early. Messi and the national team finally broke Argentina's 28-year trophy drought by winning the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2021 Copa América">2021 Copa América</a>, which helped him secure his seventh Ballon d'Or <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2021 Ballon d&#39;Or">that year</a>. He then led Argentina to win the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_Finalissima" title="2022 Finalissima">2022 Finalissima</a>, as well as the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2022 FIFA World Cup">2022 FIFA World Cup</a>, his country's third overall world championship and first in 36 years. This followed with a record-extending eighth Ballon d'Or in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2023_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2023 Ballon d&#39;Or">2023</a>, and a victory in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2024 Copa América">2024 Copa América</a>.
</p><p>Messi has endorsed sportswear company <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adidas" title="Adidas">Adidas</a> since 2006. According to <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_Football" title="France Football">France Football</a></i>, he was the world's highest-paid footballer for five years out of six between 2009 and 2014, and was ranked the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forbes_list_of_the_world%27s_highest-paid_athletes" title="Forbes list of the world&#39;s highest-paid athletes">world's highest-paid athlete</a> by <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forbes" title="Forbes">Forbes</a></i> in 2019 and 2022. Messi was among <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_(magazine)" title="Time (magazine)">Time</a></i><span class="nowrap" style="padding-left:0.1em;">'</span>s <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_100" title="Time 100">100 most influential people in the world</a> in 2011, 2012, and 2023. In 2020 and 2023, he was named the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laureus_World_Sports_Award_for_Sportsman_of_the_Year" title="Laureus World Sports Award for Sportsman of the Year">Laureus World Sportsman of the Year</a>, the first team-sport athlete to win it. In 2020, Messi was named to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ballon_d%27Or_Dream_Team" title="Ballon d&#39;Or Dream Team">Ballon d'Or Dream Team</a> and became the second footballer and second team-sport athlete to surpass $1&nbsp;billion in career earnings. Following his arrival and impact on football in the US, Messi was named <i>Time</i>'s <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_Person_of_the_Year#Athlete_of_the_Year" title="Time Person of the Year">Athlete of the Year</a> in 2023, and was bestowed with the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidential_Medal_of_Freedom" title="Presidential Medal of Freedom">Presidential Medal of Freedom</a> by US president <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Biden" title="Joe Biden">Joe Biden</a> in 2025.
</p>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r886046785">.mw-parser-output .toclimit-2 .toclevel-1 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-3 .toclevel-2 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-4 .toclevel-3 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-5 .toclevel-4 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-6 .toclevel-5 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-7 .toclevel-6 ul{display:none}</style><div class="toclimit-4"><meta property="mw:PageProp/toc"></div>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Early_life">Early life</h2></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-left" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Casa_y_barrio_de_la_infancia_de_Lionel_Messi_-_Rosario_(Santa_Fe)_03.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/Casa_y_barrio_de_la_infancia_de_Lionel_Messi_-_Rosario_(Santa_Fe)_03.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="187" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/99/Casa_y_barrio_de_la_infancia_de_Lionel_Messi_-_Rosario_%28Santa_Fe%29_03.jpg/500px-Casa_y_barrio_de_la_infancia_de_Lionel_Messi_-_Rosario_%28Santa_Fe%29_03.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="4640" data-file-height="3472"></a><figcaption>Messi's childhood home in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosario" title="Rosario">Rosario</a>, Santa Fe.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Messi was born on 24 June 1987 in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosario" title="Rosario">Rosario</a>, Santa Fe Province.<sup id="cite_ref-26" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-26"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>22<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He was the third of four children of Jorge Messi, a steel factory manager, and his wife Celia Cuccittini, who worked in a magnet manufacturing workshop. On his father's side, he is of Italian and Spanish descent, the great-grandson of immigrants from the north-central <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marche" title="Marche">Marche</a> region of Italy, and on his mother's side, he has primarily Italian ancestry.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué201332–37_4-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A9201332%E2%80%9337-4"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>3<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Growing up in a tight-knit, football-loving family, "Leo" developed a passion for the sport from an early age, playing constantly with his older brothers, Rodrigo and Matías, and his cousins, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maxi_Biancucchi" title="Maxi Biancucchi">Maximiliano</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emanuel_Biancucchi" title="Emanuel Biancucchi">Emanuel Biancucchi</a>, both of whom became professional footballers.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli20129–10_27-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli20129%E2%80%9310-27"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>23<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> 
</p><p>At the age of four he joined local club Grandoli, where he was coached by his father. Another early influence came from his maternal grandmother, Celia, who accompanied him to training and matches.<sup id="cite_ref-MagicFeet_28-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-MagicFeet-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>24<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He was greatly affected by her death, shortly before his eleventh birthday. Since then, as a devout <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catholic_Church" title="Catholic Church">Catholic</a>, he has celebrated his goals by looking up and pointing to the sky in tribute to his grandmother.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué201344–45_29-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A9201344%E2%80%9345-29"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>25<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-30" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-30"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>26<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Youth_career">Youth career</h2></div>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Newell&#39;s_Old_Boys"><span id="Newell.27s_Old_Boys"></span>Newell's Old Boys</h3></div>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1224211176">.mw-parser-output .quotebox{background-color:#F9F9F9;border:1px solid #aaa;box-sizing:border-box;padding:10px;font-size:88%;max-width:100%}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatleft{margin:.5em 1.4em .8em 0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatright{margin:.5em 0 .8em 1.4em}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.centered{overflow:hidden;position:relative;margin:.5em auto .8em auto}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatleft span,.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatright span{font-style:inherit}.mw-parser-output .quotebox>blockquote{margin:0;padding:0;border-left:0;font-family:inherit;font-size:inherit}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-title{text-align:center;font-size:110%;font-weight:bold}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-quote>:first-child{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-quote:last-child>:last-child{margin-bottom:0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-quote.quoted:before{font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-weight:bold;font-size:large;color:gray;content:" “ ";vertical-align:-45%;line-height:0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-quote.quoted:after{font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-weight:bold;font-size:large;color:gray;content:" ” ";line-height:0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox .left-aligned{text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .quotebox .right-aligned{text-align:right}.mw-parser-output .quotebox .center-aligned{text-align:center}.mw-parser-output .quotebox .quote-title,.mw-parser-output .quotebox .quotebox-quote{display:block}.mw-parser-output .quotebox cite{display:block;font-style:normal}@media screen and (max-width:640px){.mw-parser-output .quotebox{width:100%!important;margin:0 0 .8em!important;float:none!important}}</style><div class="quotebox pullquote floatleft" style="width:25%; ;">
<blockquote class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">
<p>"When you saw him you would think: this kid can't play ball. He's a dwarf, he's too fragile, too small. But immediately you'd realise that he was born different, that he was a phenomenon and that he was going to be something impressive."
</p>
</blockquote>
<div style="padding-bottom: 0; padding-top: 0.5em"><cite class="left-aligned" style="">– <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newell%27s_Old_Boys" title="Newell&#39;s Old Boys">Newell's Old Boys</a> youth coach <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adri%C3%A1n_Coria_(football_manager)" title="Adrián Coria (football manager)">Adrián Coria</a> shares his first impression of the 12-year-old Messi.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201238_31-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201238-31"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>27<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></cite></div>
</div>
<p>Messi is a lifelong supporter of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newell%27s_Old_Boys" title="Newell&#39;s Old Boys">Newell's Old Boys</a>, based in Rosario. When he was seven years old, he first started playing for Newell's. During the six years he played for them, he scored almost 500 goals, and was a member of "The Machine of '87", a nearly unbeatable youth side named for the year of their birth. Messi would regularly entertain crowds by performing ball tricks during half-time, when the first team played home games.<sup id="cite_ref-Here_32-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Here-32"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-BR_33-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-BR-33"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>29<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201231–35_34-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201231%E2%80%9335-34"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>30<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His goalscoring idol growing up was Brazilian striker <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronaldo_(Brazilian_footballer)" title="Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)">Ronaldo</a>, who Messi called "the best forward I've ever seen".<sup id="cite_ref-35" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-35"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>31<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>His future as a professional player was threatened when, aged 10, he was diagnosed with a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Growth_hormone_deficiency" title="Growth hormone deficiency">growth hormone deficiency</a>. He began <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Growth_hormone_therapy" title="Growth hormone therapy">growth hormone therapy</a> at age 11,<sup id="cite_ref-36" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-36"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>32<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> however his father's health insurance covered only two years of  the therapy, which cost at least 1,000 pesos per month. Newell's agreed to contribute, but later reneged on their promise.<sup id="cite_ref-37" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>33<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He was scouted by Buenos Aires club <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Club_Atl%C3%A9tico_River_Plate" title="Club Atlético River Plate">River Plate</a>, whose <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Playmaker" title="Playmaker">playmaker</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pablo_Aimar" title="Pablo Aimar">Pablo Aimar</a> he idolised.<sup id="cite_ref-Mission_38-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Mission-38"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>34<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Aimar_39-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Aimar-39"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>35<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> It was speculated for a time that he failed to sign with River Plate due to his ill health; however, in a 2019 interview, Messi revealed that River Plate had wanted to sign him after he scored four goals at a trial, and even offered to pay for his medical treatment, however Newell's refused to release his player card, preventing the transfer.<sup id="cite_ref-40" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-40"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>36<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Barcelona">Barcelona</h3></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:La_Masia_(Can_Planas)_(Barcelona)_-_1.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/La_Masia_(Can_Planas)_(Barcelona)_-_1.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="166" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/La_Masia_%28Can_Planas%29_%28Barcelona%29_-_1.jpg/500px-La_Masia_%28Can_Planas%29_%28Barcelona%29_-_1.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="3008" data-file-height="2000"></a><figcaption>Messi enrolled at Barcelona's youth academy, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Masia" title="La Masia">La Masia</a>, aged 13.</figcaption></figure>
<p>As the Messi family had relatives in Catalonia, they sought to arrange a trial with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a> in September 2000. First-team director <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carles_Rexach" title="Carles Rexach">Charly Rexach</a> immediately wanted to sign him, but the board of directors hesitated; at the time it was highly unusual for European clubs to sign foreign players of such a young age. On 14 December, an ultimatum was issued for Barcelona to prove their commitment, and Rexach, with no other paper at hand, offered a contract on a paper <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Napkin" title="Napkin">napkin</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Mission_38-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Mission-38"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>34<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Serviette_41-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Serviette-41"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In February 2001, the family relocated to Barcelona, where they moved into an apartment near the club's stadium, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Camp_Nou" title="Camp Nou">Camp Nou</a>. During his first year in Spain, Messi rarely played with the <i>Infantiles</i> due to a transfer conflict with Newell's; as a foreigner, he could only be fielded in friendlies and the Catalan league. Without football, he struggled to integrate into the team. He was reserved by nature, and was so quiet that some of his teammates initially believed he was mute. At home, he suffered from homesickness after his mother moved back to Rosario with his brothers and younger sister, María Sol, while he stayed in Barcelona with his father.<sup id="cite_ref-Here_32-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Here-32"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Serviette_41-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Serviette-41"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-BoyGenius_42-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-BoyGenius-42"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>38<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>After a year at Barcelona's youth academy, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Masia" title="La Masia">La Masia</a>, Messi was finally enrolled in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_Spanish_Football_Federation" title="Royal Spanish Football Federation">Royal Spanish Football Federation</a> (RFEF) in February 2002. Now he could play in all competitions, and quickly befriended his teammates, among whom were <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cesc_F%C3%A0bregas" title="Cesc Fàbregas">Cesc Fàbregas</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerard_Piqu%C3%A9" title="Gerard Piqué">Gerard Piqué</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201261–62_43-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201261%E2%80%9362-43"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>39<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> After completing his growth hormone therapy at 14,<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013149_44-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013149-44"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>40<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi became an integral part of the "Baby Dream Team", Barcelona's greatest-ever youth side. During his first full season (2002–03), he was top scorer with 36 goals in 30 games for the <i>Cadetes</i> <i>A</i>, who won an unprecedented treble of the league, the Spanish cup, and the Copa Catalunya.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201261–62_43-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201261%E2%80%9362-43"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>39<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-45" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-45"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>41<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In the Copa Catalunya final, their 4–1 victory over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RCD_Espanyol" title="RCD Espanyol">Espanyol</a> became referred to in club lore as the <i>partido de la máscara</i>, the final of the mask. A week after suffering a broken cheekbone during a league match, Messi was allowed to start the game on the condition that he wear a plastic protector; soon hindered by the mask, he took it off and scored two goals in 10 minutes before his substitution.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHunter201244–45_46-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHunter201244%E2%80%9345-46"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>42<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> At the close of the season, he received an offer to join <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arsenal_F.C." title="Arsenal F.C.">Arsenal</a>, his first from a foreign club. Although Fàbregas and Piqué soon left for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Premier_League" title="Premier League">England</a> with their own offers, Messi chose to remain in Barcelona.<sup id="cite_ref-Serviette_41-2" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Serviette-41"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-47" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-47"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>43<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Messiah_48-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Messiah-48"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>44<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Messi continued to progress through his club's ranks at a rapid pace, debuting for four youth teams during the 2003–04 season.<sup id="cite_ref-49" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-49"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>45<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> After being named player of the tournament in four separate international pre-season competitions with the <i>Juvenil B</i>, he played only one official match with the team before being promoted to the <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Barcelona_(youth)#Juvenil_A" title="FC Barcelona (youth)">Juvenil A</a></i>.  In the <i>Juvenil A</i> he scored 18 goals in 11 league games.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201268–71_50-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201268%E2%80%9371-50"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>46<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-51" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-51"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>47<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi was then one of several youth players called up to strengthen a depleted first team during the international break. French winger <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludovic_Giuly" title="Ludovic Giuly">Ludovic Giuly</a> explained that Messi caught everyone's attention in a training session with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Rijkaard" title="Frank Rijkaard">Frank Rijkaard</a>'s first team: "He destroyed us all... They were kicking him all over the place to avoid being ridiculed by this kid, he just got up and kept on playing. He would dribble past four players and score a goal. Even the team's starting centre-backs were nervous. He was an alien."<sup id="cite_ref-52" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-52"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>48<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1224211176"><div class="quotebox pullquote floatleft" style="width:25%; ;">
<blockquote class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">
<p>"It seemed as if he had been playing with us all his life."
</p>
</blockquote>
<div style="padding-bottom: 0; padding-top: 0.5em"><cite class="left-aligned" style="">– Barcelona's then assistant coach <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henk_ten_Cate" title="Henk ten Cate">Henk ten Cate</a> on Messi's first-team debut.<sup id="cite_ref-53" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-53"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>49<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></cite></div>
</div>
<p>At 16 years, four months, and 23 days old, Messi made his first-team debut when he came on in the 75th minute during a friendly against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Mourinho" title="José Mourinho">José Mourinho</a>'s <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Porto" title="FC Porto">Porto</a> on 16 November 2003.<sup id="cite_ref-Serviette_41-3" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Serviette-41"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-54" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-54"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>50<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His performance, creating two chances and a shot on goal, impressed the technical staff, and he subsequently began training daily with the club's reserve side, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barcelona_B" class="mw-redirect" title="Barcelona B">Barcelona B</a>, as well as weekly with the first team.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013191–193_55-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013191%E2%80%93193-55"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>51<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> After his first training session with the senior squad, Barça's new star player, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronaldinho" title="Ronaldinho">Ronaldinho</a>, told his teammates that he believed the 16-year-old would become an even better player than himself.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013246–249_56-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013246%E2%80%93249-56"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>52<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Ronaldinho soon befriended Messi, whom he called "little brother". This greatly eased Messi's transition into the first team.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHunter201253_57-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHunter201253-57"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>53<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-LastJump_58-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-LastJump-58"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>54<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>To gain further match experience, Messi joined <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Barcelona_C" title="FC Barcelona C">Barcelona C</a> in addition to the <i>Juvenil A</i>, playing his first game for the third team on 29 November. He helped save them from the relegation zone of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tercera_Divisi%C3%B3n" title="Tercera División">Tercera División</a>, scoring five goals in ten games, including a hat-trick in eight minutes during a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2003%E2%80%9304_Copa_del_Rey" title="2003–04 Copa del Rey">Copa del Rey</a> match while man-marked by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sevilla_FC" title="Sevilla FC">Sevilla</a>'s <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sergio_Ramos" title="Sergio Ramos">Sergio Ramos</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201268–71_50-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201268%E2%80%9371-50"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>46<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013183–185_59-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013183%E2%80%93185-59"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>55<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His progress was reflected in his first professional contract, signed on 4 February 2004, which lasted until 2012 and contained an initial <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buyout_clause" title="Buyout clause">buyout clause</a> of €30&nbsp;million. A month later, on 6 March, he made his debut for Barcelona B in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Segunda_Divisi%C3%B3n_B" title="Segunda División B">Segunda División B</a>, and his buyout clause automatically increased to €80&nbsp;million.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201268–71_50-2" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201268%E2%80%9371-50"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>46<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013262–263_60-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013262%E2%80%93263-60"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>56<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He played five games with the B team that season but did not score.<sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2003–04_61-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Matches_2003%E2%80%9304-61"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>57<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Physically he was weaker than his opponents, who were often much older and taller, and in training he worked on increasing his muscle mass and overall strength in order to be able to shake off defenders. Towards the end of the season, he returned to both youth teams, helping the <i>Juvenil B</i> win the league. He finished the campaign having scored goals for four of his five teams, with a total of 36 goals in all official competitions.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201268–71_50-3" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201268%E2%80%9371-50"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>46<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013183–185_59-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013183%E2%80%93185-59"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>55<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Club_career">Club career</h2></div>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1236090951"><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Career_of_Lionel_Messi#Club_career" title="Career of Lionel Messi">Career of Lionel Messi §&nbsp;Club career</a></div>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Barcelona_2">Barcelona</h3></div>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading4"><h4 id="2004–2008:_Rise_to_the_first_team"><span id="2004.E2.80.932008:_Rise_to_the_first_team"></span>2004–2008: Rise to the first team</h4></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-right" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Leo_messi_barce_2005.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/Leo_messi_barce_2005.jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="271" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/26/Leo_messi_barce_2005.jpg/330px-Leo_messi_barce_2005.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/26/Leo_messi_barce_2005.jpg/500px-Leo_messi_barce_2005.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1100" data-file-height="1567"></a><figcaption>Messi (pictured in 2005) at the age of 18 playing for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">FC Barcelona</a>, where he played for 17 years.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Messi began the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2004%E2%80%9305_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2004–05 FC Barcelona season">2004–05 season</a> as a guaranteed starter for the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Barcelona_B" class="mw-redirect" title="FC Barcelona B">Barcelona B</a> team, but after some lobbying by the senior players, he was promoted to the first team by manager <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Rijkaard" title="Frank Rijkaard">Frank Rijkaard</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013246–249_56-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013246%E2%80%93249-56"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>52<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He made his <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a> debut for Barcelona on 16 October 2004 against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RCD_Espanyol" title="RCD Espanyol">Espanyol</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-Serviette_41-4" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Serviette-41"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>37<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and scored his first senior goal on 1 May 2005 against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albacete_Balompi%C3%A9" title="Albacete Balompié">Albacete</a>, from an assist by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronaldinho" title="Ronaldinho">Ronaldinho</a>, becoming at that time the youngest-ever scorer for the club.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHunter201235–36_62-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHunter201235%E2%80%9336-62"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>58<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-63" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-63"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>59<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> At 17 years, three months, and 22 days old, he was at the time the youngest player to represent Barcelona in an official competition, and the club won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2004%E2%80%9305_La_Liga" title="2004–05 La Liga">league title</a> during that season.<sup id="cite_ref-LastJump_58-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-LastJump-58"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>54<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-MessiDriven_64-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-MessiDriven-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>60<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>On his 18th birthday, he signed his first contract as a senior team player, a five-year contract through 2010 with a release clause of €150 million.<sup id="cite_ref-:0_65-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-:0-65"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>61<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Three months later, as his performance continued to make waves, his contract was updated to a nine-year contract, doubling his salary and keeping him at the club until 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013262–263_60-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013262%E2%80%93263-60"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>56<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Starlet_66-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Starlet-66"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>62<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> 
</p><p>Barcelona began the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2005%E2%80%9306_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2005–06 FC Barcelona season">2005–06 season</a> by winning the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2005_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="2005 Supercopa de España">Supercopa de España</a> without Messi, who was not selected to participate in the competition.<sup id="cite_ref-FirstMiami_22-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FirstMiami-22"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>19<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> By the end of the season, the team won <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2005%E2%80%9306_La_Liga" title="2005–06 La Liga">La Liga</a> again as well as the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2005%E2%80%9306_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2005–06 UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a>, although Messi did not play in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2006_UEFA_Champions_League_final" title="2006 UEFA Champions League final">final</a> for the latter due to injury.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHunter2012266–269_67-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHunter2012266%E2%80%93269-67"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>63<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-68" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-68"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>64<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>During the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2006–07 FC Barcelona season">2006–07 season</a>, Messi scored his first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hat-trick" title="Hat-trick">hat-trick</a> in a <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Cl%C3%A1sico" title="El Clásico">Clásico</a></i> against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real_Madrid_CF" title="Real Madrid CF">Real Madrid</a>, the first player to do so in 12 years.<sup id="cite_ref-69" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-69"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>65<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> An incredibly finesse goal from Messi against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Getafe_CF" title="Getafe CF">Getafe</a> and another goal scored by a handball against Espanyol gained notice for their similarities to the two famous goals scored by fellow Argentine <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a> in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_v_England_(1986_FIFA_World_Cup)" title="Argentina v England (1986 FIFA World Cup)">1986 World Cup match against England</a>, drawing <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#Comparisons_with_Diego_Maradona">comparisons between the two</a> that Messi would face throughout his career.<sup id="cite_ref-Hawkey_70-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Hawkey-70"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>66<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-71" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-71"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>67<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Maradona_72-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Maradona-72"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>68<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The team finished the season with only one trophy – the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2006_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="2006 Supercopa de España">2006 Supercopa de España</a>. 
</p><p>Barcelona finished the next <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2007%E2%80%9308_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2007–08 FC Barcelona season">2007–08 season</a> trophyless, leading to Rijkaard's departure.<sup id="cite_ref-73" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-73"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>69<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading4"><h4 id="2008–2012:_Success_under_Pep_Guardiola"><span id="2008.E2.80.932012:_Success_under_Pep_Guardiola"></span>2008–2012: Success under Pep Guardiola</h4></div>
<p>At the beginning of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2008–09 FC Barcelona season">2008–09 season</a>, his first under Barcelona's new manager, former captain <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pep_Guardiola" title="Pep Guardiola">Pep Guardiola</a>, Messi was given the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Squad_number_(association_football)" title="Squad number (association football)">number 10</a> shirt.<sup id="cite_ref-MessiRonaldinho_74-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-MessiRonaldinho-74"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>70<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Over time, he effectively became the tactical focal point of Guardiola's possession-based system, increasing his goalscoring rate as a result.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013476–478_75-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013476%E2%80%93478-75"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>71<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> During that season, Messi scored 38 total goals, and alongside <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_Eto%27o" title="Samuel Eto&#39;o">Samuel Eto'o</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thierry_Henry" title="Thierry Henry">Thierry Henry</a>, contributed to a total of 100 goals in all competitions, a record at the time for the club.<sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2008–09_76-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Matches_2008%E2%80%9309-76"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>72<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-77" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-77"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>73<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi played as a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forward_(association_football)#False_9" title="Forward (association football)">false nine</a> for the first time in a <i>Clásico</i> against Real Madrid, setting up his side's first goal and scoring twice in the team's greatest-ever score at <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santiago_Bernab%C3%A9u_Stadium" title="Santiago Bernabéu Stadium">Santiago Bernabéu Stadium</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013453–459_78-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013453%E2%80%93459-78"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>74<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-79" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-79"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>75<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He played his first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2009_Copa_del_Rey_Final" class="mw-redirect" title="2009 Copa del Rey Final">final</a>, winning the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_Copa_del_Rey" title="2008–09 Copa del Rey">Copa del Rey</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-80" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-80"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>76<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In addition, Barcelona won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_La_Liga" title="2008–09 La Liga">La Liga title</a> and later won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2008–09 UEFA Champions League">Champions League</a>, thus achieving the first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Treble_(association_football)" title="Treble (association football)">treble</a> in the history of Spanish football.<sup id="cite_ref-81" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-81"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>77<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-left" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lionel_Messi_Joan_Gamper_Trophy.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/Lionel_Messi_Joan_Gamper_Trophy.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="167" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/Lionel_Messi_Joan_Gamper_Trophy.jpg/500px-Lionel_Messi_Joan_Gamper_Trophy.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="800"></a><figcaption>Messi during the 2009 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joan_Gamper_Trophy" title="Joan Gamper Trophy">Joan Gamper Trophy</a> against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchester_City_F.C." title="Manchester City F.C.">Manchester City</a>.</figcaption></figure>
<p>During the first half of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2009%E2%80%9310_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2009–10 FC Barcelona season">2009–10 season</a>, Barcelona would also win the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2009_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="2009 Supercopa de España">Supercopa de España</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2009_UEFA_Super_Cup" title="2009 UEFA Super Cup">UEFA Super Cup</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2009_FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="2009 FIFA Club World Cup">FIFA Club World Cup</a>, resulting in becoming the first club to achieve the sextuple.<sup id="cite_ref-82" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-82"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>78<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-83" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-83"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>79<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi finished as the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_European_Cup_and_UEFA_Champions_League_top_scorers#Top_scorers_by_season" class="mw-redirect" title="List of European Cup and UEFA Champions League top scorers">Champions League top scorer</a>, the youngest in the tournament's history.<sup id="cite_ref-84" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-84"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>80<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> For his efforts in 2009, Messi won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2009_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2009 Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a> and the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2009_FIFA_World_Player_of_the_Year" title="2009 FIFA World Player of the Year">FIFA World Player of the Year</a> award.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013519–524_85-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013519%E2%80%93524-85"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>81<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi scored a total of 47 goals in all competitions, equaling <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronaldo_(Brazilian_footballer)" title="Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)">Ronaldo</a>'s club record from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1996%E2%80%9397_FC_Barcelona_season" title="1996–97 FC Barcelona season">1996–97 campaign</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2009–10_86-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Matches_2009%E2%80%9310-86"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>82<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Deserve_87-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Deserve-87"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>83<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He finished the season as top scorer in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2009%E2%80%9310_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2009–10 UEFA Champions League">Champions League</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-88" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-88"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>84<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and La Liga, winning his <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2009%E2%80%9310_La_Liga" title="2009–10 La Liga">second consecutive league</a> trophy and earned his first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Golden_Shoe" title="European Golden Shoe">European Golden Shoe</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Deserve_87-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Deserve-87"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>83<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-89" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-89"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>85<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> After the team won the Champions League, he signed a new 7-year contract through 2016.<sup id="cite_ref-:0_65-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-:0-65"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>61<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> 
</p><p>In the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010%E2%80%9311_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2010–11 FC Barcelona season">2010–11 campaign</a>, Messi won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="2010 Supercopa de España">Supercopa de España</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-90" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-90"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>86<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010%E2%80%9311_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2010–11 UEFA Champions League">Champions League</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-91" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-91"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>87<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and a third consecutive <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010%E2%80%9311_La_Liga" title="2010–11 La Liga">La Liga title</a>. His club performances in 2010 earned him his second consecutive <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or#Winners_and_nominees" title="2010 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-autogenerated1_92-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-autogenerated1-92"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>88<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi was the top scorer in the Champions League, for the third consecutive year,<sup id="cite_ref-93" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-93"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>89<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and the league's top scorer and assist provider.<sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2010–11_94-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Matches_2010%E2%80%9311-94"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>90<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-95" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-95"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>91<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He became Barcelona's all-time single-season top scorer with 53 goals.<sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2010–11_94-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Matches_2010%E2%80%9311-94"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>90<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Sublime_96-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Sublime-96"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>92<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1224211176"><div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:25%; ;">
<blockquote class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">
<p>"I feel sorry for those who want to compete for Messi's throne – it's impossible, this kid is unique."
</p>
</blockquote>
<div style="padding-bottom: 0; padding-top: 0.5em"><cite class="left-aligned" style="">– <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pep_Guardiola" title="Pep Guardiola">Pep Guardiola</a> after Messi became Barcelona's all-time top scorer at the age of 24 in March 2012<sup id="cite_ref-97" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-97"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>93<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></cite></div>
</div>
<p>Messi began the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2011%E2%80%9312_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2011–12 FC Barcelona season">2011–12 season</a> winning both the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2011_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="2011 Supercopa de España">Spanish</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2011_UEFA_Super_Cup" title="2011 UEFA Super Cup">European Super Cups</a> trophies.<sup id="cite_ref-98" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-98"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>94<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-99" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-99"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>95<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> At the close of the year, he won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2011_FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="2011 FIFA Club World Cup">FIFA Club World Cup</a> and earned the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_FIFA_Club_World_Cup_awards#Golden_Ball" class="mw-redirect" title="List of FIFA Club World Cup awards">Golden Ball</a> for a second time.<sup id="cite_ref-100" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-100"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>96<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> For his efforts in 2011, he received the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2011_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or#Winners_and_nominees" title="2011 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">FIFA Ballon d'Or</a>, becoming only the fourth player in history to win the Ballon d'Or three times,<sup id="cite_ref-101" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-101"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>97<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and the inaugural <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Best_Player_in_Europe_Award" class="mw-redirect" title="UEFA Best Player in Europe Award">UEFA Best Player in Europe Award</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-102" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-102"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>98<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> During the year 2012, Messi became the second player to be top scorer in four Champions League campaigns.<sup id="cite_ref-103" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-103"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>99<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-104" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-104"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>100<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi became the top goalscorer in Barcelona's history at 24 years old, overtaking the 57-year record of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C%C3%A9sar_Rodr%C3%ADguez_(footballer,_born_1920)" title="César Rodríguez (footballer, born 1920)">César Rodríguez</a>'s 232 goals with a hat-trick against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Granada_CF" title="Granada CF">Granada</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-105" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-105"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>101<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He finished <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2011%E2%80%9312_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2011–12 FC Barcelona season">the season</a> as league top scorer in Spain and Europe for a second time, with 50 goals, a La Liga record, while his <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_association_football_club_records#Most_goals_in_a_season" class="mw-redirect" title="European association football club records">73 goals in all competitions</a> made him the single-season top scorer in the history of European club football excluding regional and local competitions.<sup id="cite_ref-106" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-106"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>102<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-107" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-107"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>103<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The team would also win the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Copa_del_Rey_final" title="2012 Copa del Rey final">Copa del Rey</a> that season, their 14th trophy under Guardiola, who resigned following the season after a four-year cycle of success.<sup id="cite_ref-108" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-108"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>104<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading4"><h4 id="2012–2014:_Record-breaking_year_and_Messidependencia"><span id="2012.E2.80.932014:_Record-breaking_year_and_Messidependencia"></span>2012–2014: Record-breaking year and <i>Messidependencia</i></h4></div>
<figure typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lionel_Messi,_Player_of_Argentina_national_football_team,_and_FC_Barcelona.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/Lionel_Messi,_Player_of_Argentina_national_football_team,_and_FC_Barcelona.JPG" decoding="async" width="153" height="405" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5f/Lionel_Messi%2C_Player_of_Argentina_national_football_team%2C_and_FC_Barcelona.JPG/330px-Lionel_Messi%2C_Player_of_Argentina_national_football_team%2C_and_FC_Barcelona.JPG 2x" data-file-width="2032" data-file-height="5368"></a><figcaption>Messi scored a record-breaking 91 goals with Argentina (above) and Barcelona (below) in 2012.</figcaption></figure>
<p>For the start of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012%E2%80%9313_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2012–13 FC Barcelona season">2012–13 season</a>, Barcelona had virtually secured their La Liga title by the start of 2013.<sup id="cite_ref-109" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-109"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>105<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> A double scored against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real_Betis" title="Real Betis">Real Betis</a> saw Messi becoming Barcelona's all-time top scorer in La Liga, and surpassed <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerd_M%C3%BCller" title="Gerd Müller">Gerd Müller</a>'s record of most goals scored in a calendar year; Messi would score a record 91 goals in all competitions for Barcelona and Argentina throughout 2012.<sup id="cite_ref-110" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-110"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>106<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-MostDecorated_111-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-MostDecorated-111"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>107<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi again won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or#Winners_and_nominees" title="2012 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">FIFA Ballon d'Or</a>, becoming the first player in history to win the Ballon d'Or four times.<sup id="cite_ref-MostDecorated_111-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-MostDecorated-111"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>107<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-112" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-112"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>108<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He signed a new contract committing himself to the club through 2018, and wore the captain's armband for the first time in a league match against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rayo_Vallecano" title="Rayo Vallecano">Rayo Vallecano</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013556_113-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013556-113"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>109<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-114" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-114"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>110<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-115" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-115"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>111<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The team would win <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012%E2%80%9313_La_Liga" title="2012–13 La Liga">La Liga</a> again that year, Messi's sixth, equalling Real Madrid's 100-point record of the previous season. With 60 goals in all competitions, including 46 goals in La Liga, he finished the campaign as league top scorer in Spain and Europe for the second consecutive year, becoming the first player in history to win the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Golden_Shoe" title="European Golden Shoe">European Golden Shoe</a> three times.<sup id="cite_ref-116" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-116"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>112<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Messi's overall input into the team's attack had increased significantly.
