Whereas he contributed to 24% of the team's goals in their treble-winning campaign in 2008–09, this number rose to more than 40% by the end of the 2012–13 season.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli2015ch._38_117-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli2015ch._38-117"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>113<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> These statistics, as well as lopsided losses in the Champions League where Messi was unfit, gave credence to the notion of <i>Messidependencia</i>, Barcelona's perceived tactical and psychological dependence on their star player.<sup id="cite_ref-Messidependencia_118-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Messidependencia-118"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>114<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>To offset the load on Messi, Barcelona would sign Brazilian forward <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neymar" title="Neymar">Neymar</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santos_FC" title="Santos FC">Santos</a> before the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2013–14 FC Barcelona season">2013–14 season</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-119" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-119"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>115<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The team would win the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2013_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="2013 Supercopa de España">Supercopa de España</a> at the beginning of the season.<sup id="cite_ref-120" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-120"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>116<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi finished the campaign with his worst output in five seasons, though he still managed to score 41 goals in all competitions.<sup id="cite_ref-OneFlick_121-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-OneFlick-121"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>117<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> For the first time in five years, Barcelona ended the season without a major trophy.<sup id="cite_ref-122" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-122"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>118<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading4"><h4 id="2014–2017:_Arrival_of_Luis_Enrique_and_birth_of_MSN"><span id="2014.E2.80.932017:_Arrival_of_Luis_Enrique_and_birth_of_MSN"></span>2014–2017: Arrival of Luis Enrique and birth of MSN</h4></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-left" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Moment_of_the_Champions_League_final_FC_Barcelona_-_Juventus_2015.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/250px-Moment_of_the_Champions_League_final_FC_Barcelona_-_Juventus_2015.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="184" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f4/Moment_of_the_Champions_League_final_FC_Barcelona_-_Juventus_2015.jpg/500px-Moment_of_the_Champions_League_final_FC_Barcelona_-_Juventus_2015.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="2676" data-file-height="1970"></a><figcaption>Messi dribbling past <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrice_Evra" title="Patrice Evra">Patrice Evra</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juventus_FC" title="Juventus FC">Juventus</a> during the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_UEFA_Champions_League_final" title="2015 UEFA Champions League final">2015 UEFA Champions League final</a>.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Barcelona hired coach <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Enrique" title="Luis Enrique">Luis Enrique</a> before the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2014–15 FC Barcelona season">2014–15 season</a>, and would continue to aid Messi in the attack by signing Uruguayan forward <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Su%C3%A1rez" title="Luis Suárez">Luis Suárez</a>, who had won the European Golden Shoe the year before at <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liverpool_F.C." title="Liverpool F.C.">Liverpool</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-123" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-123"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>119<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-124" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-124"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>120<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Luis Enrique's system would feature quick transitions from defense to attack, led by the front three of Messi, Suárez and Neymar. The attacking trio, which colloquially became known as 'MSN', would break goalscoring records.<sup id="cite_ref-125" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-125"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>121<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> A hat-trick scored against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sevilla_FC" title="Sevilla FC">Sevilla</a> earlier in the season would also make him the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Liga#Most_goals" title="La Liga">all-time top scorer in La Liga</a>, as he surpassed the 59-year record of 251 league goals held by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telmo_Zarra" title="Telmo Zarra">Telmo Zarra</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-126" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-126"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>122<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> After securing the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_La_Liga" title="2014–15 La Liga">La Liga title</a>, the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_Copa_del_Rey_Final" class="mw-redirect" title="2015 Copa del Rey Final">Copa del Rey</a>, and the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_UEFA_Champions_League_final" title="2015 UEFA Champions League final">Champions League</a> that year, Messi helped Barcelona become the first club to win the continental treble twice.<sup id="cite_ref-127" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-127"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>123<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-128" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-128"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>124<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He would record 58 goals, but combined with Neymar and Suárez, the attacking trio scored a total of 122 goals in all competitions that season, a record in Spanish football.<sup id="cite_ref-TooGood_129-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-TooGood-129"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>125<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Messi opened the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015%E2%80%9316_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2015–16 FC Barcelona season">2015–16 season</a> by helping Barcelona's win over Sevilla in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_UEFA_Super_Cup" title="2015 UEFA Super Cup">UEFA Super Cup</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-130" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-130"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>126<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi capped off the year by winning the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="2015 FIFA Club World Cup">2015 FIFA Club World Cup</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_FIFA_Club_World_Cup_final" title="2015 FIFA Club World Cup final">final</a> over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Club_Atl%C3%A9tico_River_Plate" title="Club Atlético River Plate">River Plate</a> in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yokohama" title="Yokohama">Yokohama</a>, collecting his fifth club trophy of the calendar year.<sup id="cite_ref-131" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-131"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>127<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 11 January 2016, Messi won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2015 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">FIFA Ballon d'Or</a> for a record fifth time in his career.<sup id="cite_ref-132" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-132"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>128<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He would end the season by winning <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015%E2%80%9316_La_Liga" title="2015–16 La Liga">La Liga</a> as well as the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2016_Copa_del_Rey_final" title="2016 Copa del Rey final">Copa del Rey</a> again.<sup id="cite_ref-133" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-133"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>129<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In total, Messi scored 41 goals, and Barcelona's attacking trio of him, Neymar and Suárez managed a Spanish record of 131 combined goals throughout the season, breaking the record they had set the previous season.<sup id="cite_ref-134" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-134"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>130<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>The <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2016%E2%80%9317_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2016–17 FC Barcelona season">2016–17 season</a> would end with Messi winning the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2016_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="2016 Supercopa de España">Supercopa de España</a> and the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2017_Copa_del_Rey_final" title="2017 Copa del Rey final">Copa del Rey</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-135" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-135"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>131<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-136" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-136"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>132<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He would finish the season with 54 goals, while his 37 goals in La Liga saw him claim both the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pichichi_Trophy" title="Pichichi Trophy">Pichichi</a> and European Golden Boot Awards for the fourth time in his career.<sup id="cite_ref-137" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-137"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>133<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi, Neymar and Suárez would combine for 110 goals by season's end. Neymar would depart for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris_Saint_Germain" class="mw-redirect" title="Paris Saint Germain">Paris Saint Germain</a> the next year, leaving the attacking trio with a combined total of 363 goals over the course of three seasons.<sup id="cite_ref-138" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-138"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>134<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Luis Enrique would also leave Barcelona at the end of the season after managing the club to a total of nine trophies during his three-year tenure.<sup id="cite_ref-139" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-139"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>135<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading4"><h4 id="2017–2021:_Final_years_at_Barcelona"><span id="2017.E2.80.932021:_Final_years_at_Barcelona"></span>2017–2021: Final years at Barcelona</h4></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lionel_Messi_vs_Valladolid.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/250px-Lionel_Messi_vs_Valladolid.jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="302" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/05/Lionel_Messi_vs_Valladolid.jpg/285px-Lionel_Messi_vs_Valladolid.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/0/05/Lionel_Messi_vs_Valladolid.jpg 2x" data-file-width="294" data-file-height="468"></a><figcaption>Messi, wearing the captain's armband, against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real_Valladolid" title="Real Valladolid">Real Valladolid</a> in 2018.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Messi would sign a new deal with Barcelona on 25 November 2017, his ninth contract with the club, keeping him with the club through 2021.<sup id="cite_ref-140" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-140"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>136<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2017%E2%80%9318_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2017–18 FC Barcelona season">2017–18 season</a> saw Messi achieving the domestic double, winning <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2017%E2%80%9318_La_Liga" title="2017–18 La Liga">La Liga</a> and the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_Copa_del_Rey_final" title="2018 Copa del Rey final">Copa del Rey</a> once again.<sup id="cite_ref-2018CdR_141-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-2018CdR-141"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>137<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He once again finished the season as the top scorer in La Liga, with 34 goals, which also saw him win his fifth European Golden Shoe award.<sup id="cite_ref-142" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-142"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>138<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> With the departure of former captain <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andr%C3%A9s_Iniesta" title="Andrés Iniesta">Andrés Iniesta</a> in May 2018, Messi was named the team's new captain for the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2018–19 FC Barcelona season">2018–19 season</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-143" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-143"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>139<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He lifted his first trophy as Barcelona's captain, the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="2018 Supercopa de España">Supercopa de España</a>, following a 2–1 victory over Sevilla. He helped Barcelona clinch the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_La_Liga" title="2018–19 La Liga">La Liga title</a>, his tenth but first as captain.<sup id="cite_ref-144" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-144"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>140<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> With 36 goals in 34 appearances that season, he won his sixth league Golden Boot trophy, equalling Zarra as the player with the most top-scorer awards in La Liga.<sup id="cite_ref-145" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-145"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>141<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-146" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-146"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>142<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He also captured his sixth Golden Shoe award, and a record third consecutive award since the 2016–17 season.<sup id="cite_ref-SixthGoldenShoe_147-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-SixthGoldenShoe-147"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>143<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Messi would win his sixth <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2019 Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a>, but the subsequent <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2019–20 FC Barcelona season">2019–20 season</a> saw Barcelona go trophyless for the first time since 2007–08.<sup id="cite_ref-148" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-148"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>144<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Following a disappointing season, Barcelona announced that Messi sent the club "a document expressing his desire to leave", but Messi ultimately decided to fulfill the final year of his contract.<sup id="cite_ref-149" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-149"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>145<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-150" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-150"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>146<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020%E2%80%9321_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2020–21 FC Barcelona season">2020–21 season</a> saw Messi surpass <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xavi_(footballer,_born_1980)" title="Xavi (footballer, born 1980)">Xavi</a>'s record to reach a club record of 768 appearances.<sup id="cite_ref-151" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-151"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>147<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He would lead the club to victory in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021_Copa_del_Rey_final" title="2021 Copa del Rey final">2021 Copa del Rey final</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-152" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-152"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>148<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-153" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-153"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>149<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His last two seasons with Barcelona saw him lead La Liga in goal scoring, giving him a record-breaking total of eight Pichichi trophies.<sup id="cite_ref-154" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-154"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>150<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-eighth_155-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-eighth-155"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>151<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Messi became a free agent after his contract expired, with negotiations on a new deal complicated due to Barcelona's financial issues.<sup id="cite_ref-156" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-156"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>152<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-157" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-157"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>153<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Barcelona would eventually announce that Messi would not be staying at the club, citing financial and structural obstacles posed by La Liga regulations as a reason for Messi's departure.<sup id="cite_ref-158" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-158"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>154<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-159" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-159"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>155<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In a tearful press conference held at the Camp Nou, Messi confirmed that he would be leaving Barcelona.<sup id="cite_ref-160" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-160"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>156<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Paris_Saint-Germain">Paris Saint-Germain</h3></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-left" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Mbappe_Messi_Neymar.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/Mbappe_Messi_Neymar.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="211" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Mbappe_Messi_Neymar.jpg/500px-Mbappe_Messi_Neymar.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="3204" data-file-height="2700"></a><figcaption>Messi (middle) with PSG team-mates <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9" title="Kylian Mbappé">Kylian Mbappé</a> (left) and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neymar" title="Neymar">Neymar</a>.</figcaption></figure>
<p>On 10 August 2021, Messi joined <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ligue_1" title="Ligue 1">Ligue 1</a> club <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain_FC" title="Paris Saint-Germain FC">Paris Saint-Germain</a> (PSG), reuniting him with Neymar, for the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_Paris_Saint-Germain_FC_season" title="2021–22 Paris Saint-Germain FC season">2021–22 season</a> on a two-year deal until June 2023 with an option for an extra year.<sup id="cite_ref-161" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-161"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>157<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-162" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-162"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>158<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi chose 30 as his squad number, the same he wore as a teenager when he made his senior debut for Barcelona.<sup id="cite_ref-163" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-163"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>159<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He would make his debut with the club against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stade_de_Reims" title="Stade de Reims">Reims</a>, made his first start and Champions League debut for the club against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Club_Brugge_KV" title="Club Brugge KV">Club Brugge</a>, and made his home debut in a match against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olympique_Lyonnais" title="Olympique Lyonnais">Lyon</a><sup id="cite_ref-164" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-164"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>160<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-165" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-165"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>161<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-166" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-166"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>162<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He scored his first goal for the club in a Champions League group stage win over former manager Pep Guardiola's <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchester_City_F.C." title="Manchester City F.C.">Manchester City</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-167" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-167"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>163<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Having scored 40 goals at club and international level for the calendar year in addition to captaining Argentina to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2021 Copa América">2021 Copa América</a>, Messi received a record <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2021 Ballon d&#39;Or">seventh Ballon d'Or</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-168" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-168"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>164<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He finished his debut season with PSG with 11 goals and 14 assists across all competitions, helping the club win their 10th <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_Ligue_1" title="2021–22 Ligue 1">Ligue 1 title</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-169" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-169"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>165<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Beginning the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022%E2%80%9323_Paris_Saint-Germain_FC_season" title="2022–23 Paris Saint-Germain FC season">2022–23 season</a>, Messi would win his second trophy with PSG in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_Troph%C3%A9e_des_Champions" title="2022 Trophée des Champions">Trophée des Champions</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-170" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-170"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>166<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> A goal against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OGC_Nice" title="OGC Nice">Nice</a> resulted in him surpassing Cristiano Ronaldo as the all-time highest goalscorer in European club football with 702 goals; during the match, he also achieved 1,000 career direct goal contributions at club level.<sup id="cite_ref-171" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-171"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>167<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-172" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-172"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>168<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> By the end of the season, he had 21 goals across all competitors and the highest number of assists in the league with 16, which helped PSG clinch their 11th <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022%E2%80%9323_Ligue_1" title="2022–23 Ligue 1">Ligue 1 title</a> and his second in a row.<sup id="cite_ref-173" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-173"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>169<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-174" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-174"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>170<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-175" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-175"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>171<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Following the last game of the season, manager <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christophe_Galtier" title="Christophe Galtier">Christophe Galtier</a> confirmed that it would be Messi's last for PSG, with the club confirming his departure two days later.<sup id="cite_ref-176" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-176"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>172<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Inter_Miami">Inter Miami</h3></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:CINvMIA_2023-08-23_-_Lionel_Messi,_Tata_Martino_(PXL_20230824_010525464)_(Messi_crop).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/CINvMIA_2023-08-23_-_Lionel_Messi,_Tata_Martino_(PXL_20230824_010525464)_(Messi_crop).jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="257" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e1/CINvMIA_2023-08-23_-_Lionel_Messi%2C_Tata_Martino_%28PXL_20230824_010525464%29_%28Messi_crop%29.jpg/330px-CINvMIA_2023-08-23_-_Lionel_Messi%2C_Tata_Martino_%28PXL_20230824_010525464%29_%28Messi_crop%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e1/CINvMIA_2023-08-23_-_Lionel_Messi%2C_Tata_Martino_%28PXL_20230824_010525464%29_%28Messi_crop%29.jpg/500px-CINvMIA_2023-08-23_-_Lionel_Messi%2C_Tata_Martino_%28PXL_20230824_010525464%29_%28Messi_crop%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="831" data-file-height="1126"></a><figcaption>Messi with Inter Miami in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2023_U.S._Open_Cup" title="2023 U.S. Open Cup">2023 U.S. Open Cup</a>.</figcaption></figure>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_League_Soccer" title="Major League Soccer">Major League Soccer</a> (MLS) club <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inter_Miami_CF" title="Inter Miami CF">Inter Miami CF</a> announced the signing of Messi on a two-and-a-half-year contract on 15 July 2023.<sup id="cite_ref-177" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-177"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>173<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-178" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-178"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>174<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi made his <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2023_Inter_Miami_CF_season" title="2023 Inter Miami CF season">2023</a> debut for the club in a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2023_Leagues_Cup" title="2023 Leagues Cup">Leagues Cup</a> match against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cruz_Azul" title="Cruz Azul">Cruz Azul</a>, scoring with a free-kick in stoppage time for a victory.<sup id="cite_ref-179" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-179"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>175<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DeAndre_Yedlin" title="DeAndre Yedlin">DeAndre Yedlin</a>, the previous captain of Inter Miami, gave his armband to Messi, who took over as team captain.<sup id="cite_ref-180" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-180"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>176<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi's arrival in the US was praised as a revelation, on and off the pitch, and his presence was credited for helping to raise the profile of MLS within the US and abroad. According to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goal_(website)" title="Goal (website)"><i>Goal</i></a>, "Every game that he graces sparks a scramble for tickets, with plenty of A-list guests eager to watch him in action".<sup id="cite_ref-181" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-181"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>177<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The frenzy over his arrival was dubbed "Messimania", and Inter Miami's No. 10 Messi jersey became the best-selling jersey in the league, and nearly the world.<sup id="cite_ref-182" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-182"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>178<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>After scoring nine goals in his first six games for Miami, Messi led the team to the club's first-ever trophy, as it won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2023_Leagues_Cup_final" title="2023 Leagues Cup final">Leagues Cup</a> against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nashville_SC" title="Nashville SC">Nashville SC</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-183" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-183"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>179<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi made his MLS debut against the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_Red_Bulls" title="New York Red Bulls">New York Red Bulls</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-184" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-184"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>180<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Miami would miss the playoffs, finishing 14th in the Eastern Conference, having gone winless in their last seven games.<sup id="cite_ref-185" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-185"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>181<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 30 October 2023, following his World Cup win with Argentina and Ligue 1 trophy with PSG, Messi was awarded a record-extending <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2023_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2023 Ballon d&#39;Or">eighth Ballon d'Or</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-186" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-186"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>182<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He was also named <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_Person_of_the_Year#Athlete_of_the_Year" title="Time Person of the Year"><i>Time</i> Athlete of the Year</a>, the first footballer ever to win the award.<sup id="cite_ref-187" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-187"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>183<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>During the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Inter_Miami_CF_season" title="2024 Inter Miami CF season">2024 season</a>, Messi broke the record for the most assists in a single MLS game with five assists, and broke the record for the most goal contributions in an MLS game with six, in a 6–2 win over the New York Red Bulls.<sup id="cite_ref-188" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-188"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>184<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 2 October, Messi scored a brace in a 3–2 win over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Columbus_Crew" title="Columbus Crew">Columbus Crew</a>, clinching the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supporters%27_Shield" title="Supporters&#39; Shield">Supporters' Shield</a>, his 46th trophy.<sup id="cite_ref-189" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-189"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>185<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In the final game of the regular season on 19 October against the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_England_Revolution" title="New England Revolution">New England Revolution</a>, Messi scored his first hat-trick for the club in a 6–2 victory. Inter Miami's victory over the Revolution also allowed the club to finish with 74 points throughout the regular season, a league record for MLS. He would finish the regular season with 20 goals and 16 assists in 19 matches.<sup id="cite_ref-190" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-190"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>186<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In doing so, he became Inter Miami's <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Inter_Miami_CF_records_and_statistics" title="List of Inter Miami CF records and statistics">all-time leading goalscorer</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-191" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-191"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>187<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Miami made its first postseason appearance in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_MLS_Cup_playoffs" title="2024 MLS Cup playoffs">2024 MLS Cup playoffs</a> but were eliminated in the first round after losing two games against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlanta_United_FC" title="Atlanta United FC">Atlanta United FC</a>. Messi would have his first postseason goal in the third game, a 3–2 loss.<sup id="cite_ref-192" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-192"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>188<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He would be named the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MLS_Most_Valuable_Player" class="mw-redirect" title="MLS Most Valuable Player">MLS Most Valuable Player</a> following the conclusion of the regular season.<sup id="cite_ref-MLSMVP_193-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-MLSMVP-193"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>189<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>During the 2025 season, Messi became the fastest person to reach 40 goals in league history.<sup id="cite_ref-:02_194-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-:02-194"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>190<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He was featured in a Superbowl ad by Apple TV for their exclusive MLS coverage.  In April he was reported to be negotiating a one-year contract extension to the end of the 2026 season, after the opening of the new Miami stadium.<sup id="cite_ref-:02_194-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-:02-194"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>190<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="International_career">International career</h2></div>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1236090951"><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Career_of_Lionel_Messi#International_career" title="Career of Lionel Messi">Career of Lionel Messi §&nbsp;International career</a></div>
<p>As a dual Argentine-Spanish national, Messi was eligible to play for the national team of both countries.<sup id="cite_ref-Burden2_195-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Burden2-195"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>191<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He debuted for Argentina in 2004 for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_under-20_football_team" title="Argentina national under-20 football team">Argentina's U20 team</a> against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paraguay_national_under-20_football_team" title="Paraguay national under-20 football team">Paraguay</a>, and was subsequently included in the squad for the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2005_South_American_U-20_Championship" title="2005 South American U-20 Championship">2005 South American U-20 Championship</a>, where they would finish third.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013209–219_196-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013209%E2%80%93219-196"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>192<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi would then lead the team to victory in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2005_FIFA_World_Youth_Championship" title="2005 FIFA World Youth Championship">2005 FIFA World Youth Championship</a>, his first success with Argentina. Finishing the tournament with six goals and two assists, he would also win the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_U-20_World_Cup#Awards" title="FIFA U-20 World Cup">Golden Ball</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-197" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-197"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>193<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-198" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-198"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>194<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-MagicMessi_199-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-MagicMessi-199"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>195<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-left" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:ARG-BRA_2008_Olympic_semi-final.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/ARG-BRA_2008_Olympic_semi-final.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="188" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/ARG-BRA_2008_Olympic_semi-final.jpg/500px-ARG-BRA_2008_Olympic_semi-final.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="900"></a><figcaption>Messi evades Brazil's <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marcelo_(footballer,_born_1988)" title="Marcelo (footballer, born 1988)">Marcelo</a> in the semi-final of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Football_at_the_2008_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_tournament" title="Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men&#39;s tournament">2008 Summer Olympics</a>.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Messi would make his debut with the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team" title="Argentina national football team">senior national team</a> in 2005, at age 18, coming off the bench in a friendly against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hungary_national_football_team" title="Hungary national football team">Hungary</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-200" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-200"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>196<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi would have his first start in 2006 against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peru_national_football_team" title="Peru national football team">Peru</a>, and would score his first international goal in a friendly against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croatia_national_football_team" title="Croatia national football team">Croatia</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-201" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-201"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>197<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Century_202-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Century-202"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>198<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His World Cup debut came in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2006_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2006 FIFA World Cup">2006 FIFA World Cup</a> as a substitute in the 74th minute against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serbia_and_Montenegro_national_football_team" title="Serbia and Montenegro national football team">Serbia and Montenegro</a>, assisting one goal and scoring the final one in their victory. This made him the youngest player to represent and score for Argentina in the World Cup.<sup id="cite_ref-203" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-203"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>199<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He would represent Argentina again for the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2007_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2007 Copa América">2007 Copa América</a>, where they would ultimately lose in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2007_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_final" title="2007 Copa América final">final</a>. Messi was named the best young player of the tournament, having scored two goals and provided one assist.<sup id="cite_ref-204" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-204"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>200<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Football_at_the_2008_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_tournament" title="Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men&#39;s tournament">2008 Summer Olympics</a> would mark another major achievement with his country, as he led <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_under-23_football_team" title="Argentina national under-23 football team">Argentina's U23 team</a> to claim the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olympic_medal" title="Olympic medal">Olympic gold medal</a> over <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigeria_national_under-23_football_team" title="Nigeria national under-23 football team">Nigeria</a>. Messi registered two goals and three assists throughout, and was singled out by FIFA as the stand-out player from the tournament's best team.<sup id="cite_ref-Messi_Olympics_205-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Messi_Olympics-205"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>201<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Suisse_vs_Argentine_-_Granit_Xhaka_%26_Lionel_Messi_crop.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/250px-Suisse_vs_Argentine_-_Granit_Xhaka_&amp;_Lionel_Messi_crop.jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="253" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/Suisse_vs_Argentine_-_Granit_Xhaka_%26_Lionel_Messi_crop.jpg/330px-Suisse_vs_Argentine_-_Granit_Xhaka_%26_Lionel_Messi_crop.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/Suisse_vs_Argentine_-_Granit_Xhaka_%26_Lionel_Messi_crop.jpg/500px-Suisse_vs_Argentine_-_Granit_Xhaka_%26_Lionel_Messi_crop.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1500" data-file-height="2000"></a><figcaption> Messi in his number 10 shirt captaining Argentina in 2012.</figcaption></figure>
<p>With the international retirement of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Rom%C3%A1n_Riquelme" title="Juan Román Riquelme">Juan Román Riquelme</a>, Messi was given Argentina's number 10 shirt.<sup id="cite_ref-telegraph.co.uk_206-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-telegraph.co.uk-206"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>202<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> During a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2010 FIFA World Cup">2010 FIFA World Cup</a> group stage match against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greece_national_football_team" title="Greece national football team">Greece</a>, where a majority of the starters rested due to a secured place in the knockout rounds, Messi would wear the captain's armband for the first time.<sup id="cite_ref-207" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-207"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>203<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Argentina were ultimately eliminated in the quarterfinals against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team">Germany</a> during that tournament, but Messi was identified as one of the tournament's 10 best players due to his pace and creativity, despite failing to register a single goal and only having one assist.<sup id="cite_ref-208" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-208"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>204<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Ahead of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2011_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2011 Copa América">2011 Copa América</a>, Argentina began building their team around Messi.<sup id="cite_ref-NewRole_209-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-NewRole-209"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>205<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> However, Messi would again be goalless during the tournament but had three assists. The team would ultimately lose to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uruguay_national_football_team" title="Uruguay national football team">Uruguay</a> in penalties during the quarter-finals.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013414–420_210-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013414%E2%80%93420-210"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>206<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-left" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Messi_in_Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_-2014-07-13_(24).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/Messi_in_Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_-2014-07-13_(24).jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="253" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/87/Messi_in_Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_-2014-07-13_%2824%29.jpg/330px-Messi_in_Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_-2014-07-13_%2824%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/87/Messi_in_Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_-2014-07-13_%2824%29.jpg/500px-Messi_in_Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_-2014-07-13_%2824%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="998" data-file-height="1331"></a><figcaption>Messi against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team">Germany</a> in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_final" title="2014 FIFA World Cup final">2014 FIFA World Cup final</a>.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Following their unsuccessful performance, a 24-year-old Messi would be awarded the captaincy of the squad.<sup id="cite_ref-211" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-211"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>207<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The next several years saw many frustrations for Messi due to his inability to lead Argentina to win an international trophy. During the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</a>, Messi and Argentina lost to Germany in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Final" class="mw-redirect" title="2014 FIFA World Cup Final">final</a>, though Messi was awarded the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_awards#Golden_Ball" title="FIFA World Cup awards">Golden Ball</a> as the best player of the tournament regardless due to his overall performance with four goals and an assist.<sup id="cite_ref-212" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-212"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>208<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-213" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-213"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>209<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Argentina would lose to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chile_national_football_team" title="Chile national football team">Chile</a> on penalties in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2015 Copa América">2015 Copa América</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_final" title="2015 Copa América final">final</a> the next year. At the close of the tournament, Messi was reportedly selected to receive the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2015_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica#Awards" title="2015 Copa América">Golden Ball</a> award, having scored one goal and provided three assists, but he rejected the honour.<sup id="cite_ref-214" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-214"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>210<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In the 2016 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Centenario" title="Copa América Centenario">Copa América Centenario</a> semi-final against the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_men%27s_national_soccer_team" title="United States men&#39;s national soccer team">United States</a>, a goal from Messi would put him ahead of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriel_Batistuta" title="Gabriel Batistuta">Gabriel Batistuta</a> as <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team#Top_goalscorers" title="Argentina national football team">Argentina's all-time leading goalscorer</a> in international matches.<sup id="cite_ref-record_215-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-record-215"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>211<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> However, Argentina would again fall to Chile on penalties in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Centenario_final" title="Copa América Centenario final">final</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Messi_retirement_216-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Messi_retirement-216"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>212<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi would have five goals and four assists throughout the tournament.<sup id="cite_ref-conmebol-stats_217-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-conmebol-stats-217"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>213<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Losing three consecutive finals in three consecutive years caused Messi to retire from international football, but a nationwide campaign in Argentina helped convince him to reverse his decision.<sup id="cite_ref-Messi_retirement_216-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Messi_retirement-216"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>212<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-218" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-218"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>214<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He would return to the national team to lead them to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2018 FIFA World Cup">2018 FIFA World Cup</a>. Argentina were in jeopardy of missing the tournament on the last game of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(CONMEBOL)" title="2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)">qualifiers</a> against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecuador_national_football_team" title="Ecuador national football team">Ecuador</a>, but a hat-trick from Messi dramatically secured their entry.<sup id="cite_ref-Guardian_2017_219-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Guardian_2017-219"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>215<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> They would go on to lose to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_national_football_team" title="France national football team">France</a> in the Round of 16 during the World Cup, with Messi having one goal and two assists in the tournament.<sup id="cite_ref-220" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-220"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>216<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The next year, Messi would again represent Argentina in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2019 Copa América">2019 Copa América</a>, where he registered only a single goal and assist. They would lose to hosts <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil</a> in the semi-final but ended with a third-place finish after defeating Chile.<sup id="cite_ref-221" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-221"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>217<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Despite not winning the tournament, this victory would mark the beginning of a 36-game unbeaten streak for Argentina that would last for over three years.<sup id="cite_ref-unbeaten_222-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-unbeaten-222"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>218<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Argentina_vs_mexico_messi_vs_erick_gutierrez_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/Argentina_vs_mexico_messi_vs_erick_gutierrez_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="209" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/20/Argentina_vs_mexico_messi_vs_erick_gutierrez_%28cropped%29.jpg/500px-Argentina_vs_mexico_messi_vs_erick_gutierrez_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="548" data-file-height="459"></a><figcaption>Messi facing off against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%89rick_Guti%C3%A9rrez" title="Érick Gutiérrez">Érick Gutiérrez</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico_national_football_team" title="Mexico national football team">Mexico</a> in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2022 FIFA World Cup">2022 FIFA World Cup</a> group stage.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Messi would finally end Argentina's 28-year trophy drought in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2021 Copa América">2021 Copa América</a>, as they had not won an international tournament since <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1993_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="1993 Copa América">1993</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Messi_Copa_América_223-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Messi_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica-223"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>219<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> During a group stage match against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bolivia_national_football_team" title="Bolivia national football team">Bolivia</a>, he surpassed <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Javier_Mascherano" title="Javier Mascherano">Javier Mascherano</a> to become <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team#Most-capped_players" title="Argentina national football team">Argentina's most-capped player</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-224" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-224"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>220<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Argentina defeated Brazil in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_final" title="2021 Copa América final">final</a>, and Messi was named the player of the tournament having been directly involved in nine out of the 12 goals scored by Argentina, scoring four of them and assisting five.<sup id="cite_ref-Messi_Copa_América_223-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Messi_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica-223"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>219<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He captained Argentina to win another international trophy in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_Finalissima" title="2022 Finalissima">2022 Finalissima</a> against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2020" title="UEFA Euro 2020">UEFA Euro 2020</a> winners <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy_national_football_team" title="Italy national football team">Italy</a>, where he was named player of the match after providing two assists.<sup id="cite_ref-Messi_CONMEBOL–UEFA_Cup_225-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Messi_CONMEBOL%E2%80%93UEFA_Cup-225"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>221<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> At the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2022 FIFA World Cup">2022 FIFA World Cup</a>, Messi led Argentina to its first World Cup victory in 36 years, scoring twice in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_final" title="2022 FIFA World Cup final">final</a> to defeat France.<sup id="cite_ref-ArgentinaRecord_226-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-ArgentinaRecord-226"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>222<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Having scored seven goals and assisting three during the tournament, Messi would again win the Golden Ball, becoming the first player to win it twice.<sup id="cite_ref-BCC221218_227-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-BCC221218-227"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>223<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His appearance in the final also set new records for the most appearances (26) and direct goal contributions (21 – 13 goals and 8 assists) at the World Cup.<sup id="cite_ref-228" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-228"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>224<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>A hat-trick in a 2023 friendly against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cura%C3%A7ao_national_football_team" title="Curaçao national football team">Curaçao</a> saw Messi reach 100 international goals, the third player and the first South American in history to achieve this milestone.<sup id="cite_ref-229" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-229"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>225<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Later that year, a goal against Peru resulted in Messi becoming the all-time top goalscorer in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CONMEBOL" title="CONMEBOL">CONMEBOL</a> World Cup qualifiers.<sup id="cite_ref-230" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-230"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>226<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> During the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2024 Copa América">2024 Copa América</a> semi-final against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada_men%27s_national_soccer_team" title="Canada men&#39;s national soccer team">Canada</a>, Messi scored his first and only goal of the tournament which also made him the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_men%27s_footballers_with_50_or_more_international_goals#By_player" title="List of men&#39;s footballers with 50 or more international goals">second-highest international goalscorer</a> of all time.<sup id="cite_ref-231" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-231"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>227<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Argentina eventually won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_final" title="2024 Copa América final">final</a> against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia_national_football_team" title="Colombia national football team">Colombia</a> for their second consecutive Copa América title, with Messi contributing one goal and assist overall while also setting a new record for most appearances (39) at Copa América.<sup id="cite_ref-232" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-232"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>228<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Player_profile">Player profile</h2></div>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Style_of_play">Style of play</h3></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_04_crop.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_04_crop.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="188" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_04_crop.jpg/500px-Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_04_crop.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="3776" data-file-height="2832"></a><figcaption>Messi prepares to shoot with his dominant left foot in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_final" title="2014 FIFA World Cup final">2014 FIFA World Cup final</a>.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Due to his short stature, Messi has a lower centre of gravity than taller players, which gives him greater agility, allowing him to change direction more quickly and evade opposing tackles;<sup id="cite_ref-GoldenYell_233-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-GoldenYell-233"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>229<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FiveReasons_234-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FiveReasons-234"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>230<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> this has led the Spanish media to dub him <i><b>La Pulga Atómica</b></i> ("The Atomic Flea").<sup id="cite_ref-235" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-235"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>231<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-236" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-236"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>232<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-237" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-237"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>233<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Despite being physically unimposing, he possesses significant upper-body strength, which, combined with his low centre of gravity and resulting balance, aids him in withstanding physical challenges from opponents; he has consequently been noted for his lack of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diving_(association_football)" title="Diving (association football)">diving</a> in a sport rife with playacting.<sup id="cite_ref-Here_32-2" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Here-32"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FiveReasons_234-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FiveReasons-234"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>230<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-MakingCase_238-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-MakingCase-238"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>234<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His short, strong legs allow him to excel in short bursts of acceleration while his quick feet enable him to retain control of the ball when <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dribbling#Association_football" title="Dribbling">dribbling</a> at speed.<sup id="cite_ref-239" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-239"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>235<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His former Barcelona manager <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pep_Guardiola" title="Pep Guardiola">Pep Guardiola</a> once stated, "Messi is the only player that runs faster with the ball than he does without it."<sup id="cite_ref-FTMag_240-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FTMag-240"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>236<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Although he has improved his ability with his weaker foot since his mid-20s, Messi is predominantly a left-footed player; with the outside of his left foot, he usually begins dribbling runs, while he uses the inside of his foot to finish and provide passes and assists.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013553_241-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013553-241"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>237<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Control_242-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Control-242"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>238<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>A prolific goalscorer, Messi is known for his finishing, positioning, quick reactions, and ability to make attacking runs to beat the defensive line. He also functions in a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Playmaker" title="Playmaker">playmaking</a> role, courtesy of his vision and range of passing.<sup id="cite_ref-243" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-243"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>239<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He has often been described as a magician; a conjurer, creating goals and opportunities where seemingly none exist.<sup id="cite_ref-244" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-244"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>240<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-245" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-245"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>241<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-246" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-246"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>242<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Moreover, he is an accurate <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Direct_free_kick" class="mw-redirect" title="Direct free kick">free kick</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penalty_kick_(association_football)" title="Penalty kick (association football)">penalty kick</a> taker.<sup id="cite_ref-FiveReasons_234-2" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FiveReasons-234"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>230<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-SixReasons_247-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-SixReasons-247"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>243<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> As of September 2023, Messi ranks fifth all time in goals scored from direct free kicks with 65,<sup id="cite_ref-248" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-248"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>244<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> the most among active players.<sup id="cite_ref-249" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-249"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>245<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He also has a penchant for scoring from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chip_(association_football)" title="Chip (association football)">chips</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-250" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-250"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>246<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-left" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:2011_FIFA_Club_World_Cup_FC_Barcelona_vs_Al_Sadd.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/2011_FIFA_Club_World_Cup_FC_Barcelona_vs_Al_Sadd.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="167" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6f/2011_FIFA_Club_World_Cup_FC_Barcelona_vs_Al_Sadd.jpg/500px-2011_FIFA_Club_World_Cup_FC_Barcelona_vs_Al_Sadd.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="5184" data-file-height="3456"></a><figcaption>Messi's dribbling abilities allow him to weave past several defenders and orchestrate attacking plays.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Messi's pace and technical ability enable him to undertake individual dribbling runs towards goal, in particular during counterattacks, usually starting from the halfway line or the right side of the pitch.<sup id="cite_ref-MakingCase_238-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-MakingCase-238"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>234<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-SixReasons_247-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-SixReasons-247"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>243<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-251" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-251"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>247<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He is widely considered to be one of the greatest dribblers of all time.<sup id="cite_ref-252" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-252"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>248<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-253" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-253"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>249<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> With regard to this ability, his former Argentina manager <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a> has said of him, "The ball stays glued to his foot; I've seen great players in my career, but I've never seen anyone with Messi's ball control."<sup id="cite_ref-Control_242-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Control-242"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>238<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Beyond his individual qualities, he is also a well-rounded, hard-working team player, known for his creative combinations, in particular with former Barcelona midfielders <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xavi_(footballer,_born_1980)" title="Xavi (footballer, born 1980)">Xavi</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andr%C3%A9s_Iniesta" title="Andrés Iniesta">Andrés Iniesta</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-GoldenYell_233-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-GoldenYell-233"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>229<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FiveReasons_234-3" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FiveReasons-234"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>230<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>As his career advanced, and his athleticism and tendency to dribble diminished slightly with age, Messi began to dictate play in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midfielder#Deep-lying_playmaker_(Strolling_10)" title="Midfielder">deeper areas of the pitch</a> and developed into one of the best passers and playmakers in football history.<sup id="cite_ref-254" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-254"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>250<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-255" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-255"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>251<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-256" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-256"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>252<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His work-rate off the ball and defensive responsibilities also decreased as his career progressed; by covering less ground on the pitch, and instead conserving his energy for short bursts of speed, he was able to improve his efficiency, movement, and positional play, and was also able to avoid muscular injuries, despite often playing a large number of matches throughout a particular season on a consistent basis. Indeed, while he was injury-prone in his early career, he was later able to improve his injury record by running less off the ball, and by adopting a stricter diet, training regime, and sleep schedule.<sup id="cite_ref-257" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-257"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>253<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Tactical_positioning">Tactical positioning</h3></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Argentina_team_in_St._Petersburg_(cropped)_Messi.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/180px-Argentina_team_in_St._Petersburg_(cropped)_Messi.jpg" decoding="async" width="180" height="317" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/0/0e/Argentina_team_in_St._Petersburg_%28cropped%29_Messi.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="183" data-file-height="322"></a><figcaption>A versatile forward, Messi often plays as a classic <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midfielder#Attacking_midfielder" title="Midfielder">number 10</a>.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Tactically, Messi plays in a free attacking role; a versatile player, he is capable of attacking on either wing or through the centre of the pitch. His favoured position in childhood was the playmaker behind two strikers, known as the <i>enganche</i> in Argentine football, but he began his career in Spain as a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Association_football_positions#Winger" title="Association football positions">left-winger</a> or <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forward_(association_football)#Second_striker" title="Forward (association football)">left-sided forward</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013155–156,_405–406_258-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013155%E2%80%93156,_405%E2%80%93406-258"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>254<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Upon his first-team debut, he was moved onto the right wing by manager <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Rijkaard" title="Frank Rijkaard">Frank Rijkaard</a>; from this position, he could more easily cut through the defence into the middle of the pitch and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curl_(football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Curl (football)">curl</a> shots on goal with his left foot, rather than predominantly <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross_(football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Cross (football)">cross</a> balls for teammates.<sup id="cite_ref-FTMag_240-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FTMag-240"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>236<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Under Guardiola and subsequent managers, he most often played in a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forward_(association_football)#False_9" title="Forward (association football)">false nine</a> role; positioned as a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forward_(association_football)#Centre-forward" title="Forward (association football)">centre-forward</a> or lone <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forward_(association_football)#Striker" title="Forward (association football)">striker</a>, he would roam the centre, often moving deep into midfield and drawing defenders with him, in order to create and exploit spaces for passes, other teammates' attacking runs off the ball, Messi's own dribbling runs, or combinations with Xavi and Iniesta.<sup id="cite_ref-BoyGenius_42-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-BoyGenius-42"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>38<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Under the stewardship of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Enrique" title="Luis Enrique">Luis Enrique</a>, Messi initially returned to playing in the right-sided position that characterised much of his early career in the manager's 4–3–3 formation,<sup id="cite_ref-259" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-259"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>255<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-260" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-260"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>256<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> while he was increasingly deployed in a deeper, free playmaking role in later seasons.<sup id="cite_ref-261" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-261"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>257<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-improvement_262-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-improvement-262"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>258<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Under manager <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernesto_Valverde" title="Ernesto Valverde">Ernesto Valverde</a>, Messi played in a variety of roles.
