While he occasionally continued to be deployed in a deeper role, from which he could make runs from behind into the box,<sup id="cite_ref-263" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-263"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>259<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> or even on the right wing<sup id="cite_ref-264" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-264"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>260<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> or as a false nine,<sup id="cite_ref-265" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-265"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>261<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-266" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-266"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>262<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> he was also used in a more offensive, central role in a 4–2–3–1,<sup id="cite_ref-improvement_262-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-improvement-262"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>258<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> or as a second striker in a 4–4–2 formation, where he was once again given the licence to drop deep, link-up with midfielders, orchestrate his team's attacking plays, and create chances for his attacking partner <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Su%C3%A1rez" title="Luis Suárez">Luis Suárez</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-267" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-267"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>263<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-268" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-268"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>264<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> With the Argentina national team, Messi has similarly played anywhere along the frontline. Under various managers, he has been employed on the right wing, as a false nine, as an out-and-out striker, in a supporting role alongside another forward, or in a deeper, free creative role as a classic number 10 playmaker or <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midfielder#Attacking_midfielder" title="Midfielder">attacking midfielder</a> behind the strikers.<sup id="cite_ref-269" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-269"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>265<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-270" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-270"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>266<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Reception">Reception</h2></div>
<p>Messi is widely regarded as one of the two best players of his generation, alongside Portuguese forward <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo" title="Cristiano Ronaldo">Cristiano Ronaldo</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-RonaldoRivalry_271-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-RonaldoRivalry-271"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>267<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He is also considered one of the greatest footballers in the history of the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-goat_272-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-goat-272"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>268<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>A prodigious talent as a teenager, Messi established himself among the world's best players before age 20.<sup id="cite_ref-273" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-273"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>269<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Shortly after teammate <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronaldinho" title="Ronaldinho">Ronaldinho</a> won the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2005_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2005 Ballon d&#39;Or">2005 Ballon d'Or</a>, he commented, "I'm not even the best at Barça" in reference to his 18-year-old protégé.<sup id="cite_ref-274" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-274"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>270<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Four years later, after Messi won his first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ballon_d%27Or" title="Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a> by a record margin,<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013519–524_85-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013519%E2%80%93524-85"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>81<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> the public debate regarding his qualities as a player moved beyond his status in contemporary football to the possibility that he was one of the greatest players in history.<sup id="cite_ref-MagicFeet_28-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-MagicFeet-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>24<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-MakingCase_238-2" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-MakingCase-238"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>234<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-275" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-275"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>271<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> An early proponent was his then-<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a> manager <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pep_Guardiola" title="Pep Guardiola">Pep Guardiola</a>, who, as early as August 2009, declared Messi to be the best player he had ever seen.<sup id="cite_ref-276" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-276"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>272<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In the following years, this opinion gained greater acceptance among pundits, managers, former and current players.<sup id="cite_ref-Sublime_96-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Sublime-96"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>92<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-277" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-277"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>273<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> By the end of Barça's second treble-winning season, the view of Messi as one of the greatest footballers of all time had become the apparent view among many fans and pundits in continental Europe.<sup id="cite_ref-Telegraph_2016_278-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Telegraph_2016-278"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>274<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-279" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-279"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>275<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Messi would receive dismissals by critics throughout his career based on the fact that he had not won an international tournament at senior level with Argentina.<sup id="cite_ref-laughable_280-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-laughable-280"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>276<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-281" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-281"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>277<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Lea_282-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Lea-282"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>278<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> However, his subsequent victories in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2021 Copa América">2021 Copa América</a> and the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2022 FIFA World Cup">2022 FIFA World Cup</a> resulted in him finally winning every top tier trophy at both the club and country levels, an achievement that many pundits felt cemented Messi's legacy.<sup id="cite_ref-goat_272-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-goat-272"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>268<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Comparisons_with_Cristiano_Ronaldo">Comparisons with Cristiano Ronaldo</h3></div>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1236090951"><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messi%E2%80%93Ronaldo_rivalry" title="Messi–Ronaldo rivalry">Messi–Ronaldo rivalry</a></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina,_9th_February_2011.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina,_9th_February_2011.jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="253" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d6/Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina%2C_9th_February_2011.jpg/330px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina%2C_9th_February_2011.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d6/Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina%2C_9th_February_2011.jpg/500px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina%2C_9th_February_2011.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2115" data-file-height="2820"></a><figcaption>Messi has been compared with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo" title="Cristiano Ronaldo">Cristiano Ronaldo</a> (left) throughout much of their careers.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Among his contemporary peers, Messi is most often compared and contrasted with Cristiano Ronaldo, who many consider his <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messi%E2%80%93Ronaldo_rivalry" title="Messi–Ronaldo rivalry">career rival</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-RonaldoRivalry_271-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-RonaldoRivalry-271"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>267<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Both achieved numerous individual accolades, won dozens of trophies for both club and country, and are the two <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_footballers_with_500_or_more_goals" title="List of footballers with 500 or more goals">leading goal scorers in history</a>. Although Messi has at times denied any rivalry,<sup id="cite_ref-283" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-283"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>279<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-284" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-284"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>280<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> they are widely believed to push one another in their aim to be the best player in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-Overtaken_285-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Overtaken-285"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>281<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Pundits have compared the ongoing rivalry to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_sports_rivalries" title="List of sports rivalries">past sports rivalries</a> like the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muhammad_Ali" title="Muhammad Ali">Muhammad Ali</a>–<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Frazier" title="Joe Frazier">Joe Frazier</a> rivalry in boxing, the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prost%E2%80%93Senna_rivalry" title="Prost–Senna rivalry">Prost–Senna rivalry</a> in motorsport, and the tennis rivalries between <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federer%E2%80%93Nadal_rivalry" title="Federer–Nadal rivalry">Federer–Nadal</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Borg%E2%80%93McEnroe_rivalry" title="Borg–McEnroe rivalry">Borg–McEnroe</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-286" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-286"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>282<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Fans and pundits alike regularly argue the individual merits of both players.<sup id="cite_ref-Overtaken_285-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Overtaken-285"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>281<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-287" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-287"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>283<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi is lauded for his combination of dribbling, playmaking, passing and goalscoring, while Ronaldo has received praise for his exceptional speed and athleticism, goalscoring skills, and performance under pressure.<sup id="cite_ref-288" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-288"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>284<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-289" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-289"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>285<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Beyond their playing styles, the debate also revolves around their differing physiques – Ronaldo is <style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1154941027">.mw-parser-output .frac{white-space:nowrap}.mw-parser-output .frac .num,.mw-parser-output .frac .den{font-size:80%;line-height:0;vertical-align:super}.mw-parser-output .frac .den{vertical-align:sub}.mw-parser-output .sr-only{border:0;clip:rect(0,0,0,0);clip-path:polygon(0px 0px,0px 0px,0px 0px);height:1px;margin:-1px;overflow:hidden;padding:0;position:absolute;width:1px}</style>1.87&nbsp;m (6&nbsp;ft <span class="frac">1<span class="sr-only">+</span><span class="num">1</span>⁄<span class="den">2</span></span>&nbsp;in) with a muscular build, compared to Messi's smaller size – and contrasting public personalities with Ronaldo's self-confidence and theatrics a foil to Messi's humility.<sup id="cite_ref-290" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-290"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>286<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Regarding individual achievements, Messi has won eight Ballons d'Or to Ronaldo's five,<sup id="cite_ref-291" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-291"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>287<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> eight <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Men%27s_Player#FIFA_Player_of_the_Year_(including_predecessors)" title="The Best FIFA Men&#39;s Player">FIFA World's Best Player</a> awards to Ronaldo's five, and six <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Golden_Shoe" title="European Golden Shoe">European Golden Shoes</a> to Ronaldo's four.<sup id="cite_ref-292" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-292"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>288<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Off the pitch, Ronaldo is his direct competitor in terms of salary, sponsorships, and social media fanbase.<sup id="cite_ref-50million_293-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-50million-293"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>289<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Messi's <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messi-Ronaldo_rivalry#Head-to-head_summary" class="mw-redirect" title="Messi-Ronaldo rivalry">head-to-head record</a> against teams that feature Ronaldo consists of 15 wins, 9 draws, and 10 losses in competitive club matches, one win and loss each in international friendlies, and one win in a club friendly. The first competitive matchup between the two occurred in 2008, when Ronaldo's <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchester_United" class="mw-redirect" title="Manchester United">Manchester United</a> were drawn to play Messi's Barcelona in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2007%E2%80%9308_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_stage#Semi-finals" title="2007–08 UEFA Champions League knockout stage">2007–08 UEFA Champions League semi-finals</a>, where Ronaldo and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchester_United" class="mw-redirect" title="Manchester United">Manchester United</a> would eventually advance 1–0 on aggregate, and go on to win the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2008_UEFA_Champions_League_final" title="2008 UEFA Champions League final">final</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-294" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-294"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>290<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The two players and their teams would meet again in the next year's Champions League, this time in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2009_UEFA_Champions_League_final" title="2009 UEFA Champions League final">the final</a>, with Messi and Barcelona emerging as the victors after a 2–0 result.<sup id="cite_ref-295" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-295"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>291<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> After this, Ronaldo would transfer to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real_Madrid" class="mw-redirect" title="Real Madrid">Real Madrid</a>, the main rivals of Barcelona, and from 2009–10 to 2017–18, Messi faced Ronaldo at least twice every season in <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Cl%C3%A1sico" title="El Clásico">El Clásico</a></i>, which ranks among the world's most viewed annual sports events.<sup id="cite_ref-296" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-296"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>292<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-50million_293-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-50million-293"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>289<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Ronaldo's would then transfer to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juventus_FC" title="Juventus FC">Juventus</a> in the summer of 2018; their final matchup in a competitive match would occur during a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020%E2%80%9321_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2020–21 UEFA Champions League">2020–21 UEFA Champions League</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020%E2%80%9321_UEFA_Champions_League_group_stage#Barcelona_v_Juventus" title="2020–21 UEFA Champions League group stage">group stage match</a>, where Ronaldo's two goals from the penalty spot helped Juventus to a 3–0 victory against Messi's Barcelona.<sup id="cite_ref-297" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-297"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>293<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> After Ronaldo left Real Madrid for Juventus, Messi stated: "I miss Cristiano. Although it was a bit difficult to see him win trophies, he gave <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a> prestige."<sup id="cite_ref-298" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-298"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>294<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Following Messi leading Argentina to victory in the 2022 World Cup, a number of football critics, commentators, and players have opined that Messi settled the debate between the two players.<sup id="cite_ref-299" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-299"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>295<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-300" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-300"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>296<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Ronaldo himself declared a year later that his rivalry with Messi was over and "gone", after 36 official fixtures and 15 years of "sharing the stage".<sup id="cite_ref-301" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-301"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>297<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Comparisons_with_Diego_Maradona">Comparisons with Diego Maradona</h3></div>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1236090951"><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Maradona" title="New Maradona">New Maradona</a></div>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1224211176"><div class="quotebox pullquote floatleft" style="width:25%; ;">
<blockquote class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">
<p>"I have seen the player who will inherit my place in Argentinian football and his name is Messi."
</p>
</blockquote>
<div style="padding-bottom: 0; padding-top: 0.5em"><cite class="left-aligned" style="">– <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a> hailing the 18-year-old Messi as his <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Maradona" title="New Maradona">successor</a> in February 2006.<sup id="cite_ref-successor_302-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-successor-302"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>298<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></cite></div>
</div>
<p>Throughout his career, Messi has been compared with his compatriot <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a>, who was also considered the best player of his generation and one of greatest in the history of the sport.<sup id="cite_ref-adept_303-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-adept-303"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>299<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-304" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-304"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>300<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> This was due to their short statures, their similar playing styles as diminutive, left-footed <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Playmaker" title="Playmaker">playmakers</a>, and the fact that they both came from Argentina.<sup id="cite_ref-Daily_305-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Daily-305"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>301<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Initially, Messi was merely one of many young Argentine players to receive the "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Maradona" title="New Maradona">New Maradona</a>" moniker, but as his career progressed, Messi proved his similarity beyond all previous contenders, establishing himself as the best player Argentina had produced since Maradona.<sup id="cite_ref-Aimar_39-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Aimar-39"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>35<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELisi2011533–539_306-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTELisi2011533%E2%80%93539-306"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>302<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Even when Messi was 18 years old, Maradona called him the best player in the world and hailed him as his successor.<sup id="cite_ref-successor_302-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-successor-302"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>298<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi and Maradona would work together as player and manager for Argentina's <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team" title="Argentina national football team">national side</a> from 2008 through the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2010 FIFA World Cup">2010 FIFA World Cup</a>, the latter thoroughly impressed with the former's skills.<sup id="cite_ref-307" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-307"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>303<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> It was during this period that Messi was given Argentina's number 10 shirt that Maradona famously wore. Maradona gave Messi his blessing, telling him: "the No 10 is yours. There's nobody better than you to wear it."<sup id="cite_ref-telegraph.co.uk_206-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-telegraph.co.uk-206"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>202<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-right" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Maradona_vs_england.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/Maradona_vs_england.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="173" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/67/Maradona_vs_england.jpg/500px-Maradona_vs_england.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="850" data-file-height="588"></a><figcaption>Due to their similar size and style of play, Messi was constantly compared with his compatriot <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a> by pundits and his countrymen.</figcaption></figure>
<p>During the early and middle parts of his career, Messi was generally held in lesser esteem than Maradona in Argentine society. Part of this had to do with Messi's lack of tournament success and perceived uneven output with the national team during this period – Maradona had famously led Argentina to victory in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1986_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1986 FIFA World Cup">1986 FIFA World Cup</a> with a dominant overall performance, which set expectations for Messi to do the same.<sup id="cite_ref-laughable_280-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-laughable-280"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>276<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-adept_303-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-adept-303"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>299<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Burden_308-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Burden-308"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>304<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Also unlike Maradona, Messi never played in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentine_Primera_Divisi%C3%B3n" title="Argentine Primera División">Argentine Primera División</a>, therefore depriving his countrymen a chance to watch him develop and prove himself, and through no fault of his own would do this overseas in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a> instead.<sup id="cite_ref-Here_32-3" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Here-32"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Burden_308-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Burden-308"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>304<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Argentines also identified more with the fiery, extroverted and controversial Maradona who came from the slums, character traits that they felt aligned with their national values, as opposed to the reserved, introverted and unassuming Messi who had a comparably unremarkable upbringing in Rosario.<sup id="cite_ref-Lea_282-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Lea-282"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>278<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Burden_308-2" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Burden-308"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>304<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-309" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-309"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>305<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Several pundits, footballing figures, and Maradona himself would point to this temperament to question Messi's leadership capabilities for the national team.<sup id="cite_ref-laughable_280-2" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-laughable-280"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>276<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-310" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-310"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>306<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-311" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-311"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>307<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Furthermore, Messi's lack of outward passion for the <i>Albiceleste</i> shirt, early tendency not to sing the national anthem, and disinclination to emotional displays have in the past led to the false perception that he felt more Catalan rather than truly Argentine.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013414–420_210-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013414%E2%80%93420-210"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>206<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Vickery_312-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Vickery-312"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>308<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> However, despite having lived in Barcelona since age 13, Messi rejected the option of representing <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain_national_football_team" title="Spain national football team">Spain</a> internationally, saying: "Argentina is my country, my family, my way of expressing myself. I would change all my records to make the people in my country happy."<sup id="cite_ref-313" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-313"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>309<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-right" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Pasi%C3%B3n_de_Multitudes_-_52579041250.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/Pasión_de_Multitudes_-_52579041250.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="167" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/47/Pasi%C3%B3n_de_Multitudes_-_52579041250.jpg/500px-Pasi%C3%B3n_de_Multitudes_-_52579041250.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="6720" data-file-height="4480"></a><figcaption>A mural featuring both Maradona and Messi following Argentina's World Cup win in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2022 FIFA World Cup">2022</a>.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Football journalist <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tim_Vickery" title="Tim Vickery">Tim Vickery</a> stated the perception of Messi among Argentines changed in 2019, with Messi making a conscious effort to become "more one of the group, more Argentine".<sup id="cite_ref-Vickery_312-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Vickery-312"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>308<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Other pundits noted that Messi had grown more assertive as a leader during the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2019 Copa América">2019 Copa América</a> by becoming more vocal with his teammates both on and off the pitch, finally singing the national anthem with the team before matches, and speaking with journalists at length after matches, the latter of which he rarely did for Barcelona.<sup id="cite_ref-314" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-314"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>310<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Following the 2022 World Cup win for Messi and Argentina, Vickery felt that Messi would now be held in the same esteem by his compatriots as Maradona.<sup id="cite_ref-Vickery_312-2" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Vickery-312"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>308<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Former footballer turned journalist <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jorge_Valdano" title="Jorge Valdano">Jorge Valdano</a> said he saw a "Maradonian" edge to Messi's performances during the tournament, while compatriot <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osvaldo_Ardiles" title="Osvaldo Ardiles">Osvaldo Ardiles</a> mentioned that Messi's provoking actions against the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands_national_football_team" title="Netherlands national football team">Netherlands side</a> during the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Lusail" title="Battle of Lusail">quarter-final</a> were "more of a Maradona reaction," further endearing Messi to his countrymen.<sup id="cite_ref-315" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-315"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>311<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-ArdilesMessi_316-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-ArdilesMessi-316"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>312<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi himself later remarked that the World Cup victory "won over all the people of Argentina. Today 95% or 100% of Argentines love me and that's a beautiful feeling."<sup id="cite_ref-317" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-317"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>313<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="In_popular_culture">In popular culture</h2></div>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Popularity">Popularity</h3></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-right" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lionel_MESSI_Florent_TORCHUT.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/250px-Lionel_MESSI_Florent_TORCHUT.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="200" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/Lionel_MESSI_Florent_TORCHUT.jpg/500px-Lionel_MESSI_Florent_TORCHUT.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="3440" data-file-height="2752"></a><figcaption>Messi's success on the pitch earned him several lucrative endorsement deals along with widespread recognition and popularity.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Messi was among the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_100" title="Time 100"><i>Time</i> 100</a>, an annual list of the world's most influential people, in 2011, 2012 and 2023.<sup id="cite_ref-318" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-318"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>314<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-319" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-319"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>315<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-320" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-320"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>316<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> According to a 2014 survey in 15 international markets, Messi was familiar to 87% of respondents around the world, of whom 78% perceived him favourably, making him the second-most recognised player globally, behind Cristiano Ronaldo, and the most likable of all contemporary players.<sup id="cite_ref-321" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-321"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>317<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-322" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-322"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>318<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Press_Photo" title="World Press Photo">World Press Photo</a> selected "The Final Game", a photo of Messi facing the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Trophy" title="FIFA World Cup Trophy">World Cup trophy</a> after Argentina's final defeat to Germany, as the best sports image of 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-323" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-323"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>319<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On his economic impact on the city in which he plays, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terry_Gibson" title="Terry Gibson">Terry Gibson</a> called him a "tourist attraction".<sup id="cite_ref-324" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-324"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>320<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>His fanbase on <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facebook" title="Facebook">Facebook</a> is among the largest of public figures: within seven hours of its launch in April 2011, Messi's Facebook page had nearly seven million followers, and by July 2023 he had <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_most-followed_Facebook_pages" title="List of most-followed Facebook pages">over 114 million followers</a>, the second highest for a sportsperson after Ronaldo.<sup id="cite_ref-325" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-325"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>321<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-326" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-326"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>322<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He has over 500 million <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Instagram" title="Instagram">Instagram</a> followers, the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_most-followed_Instagram_accounts" title="List of most-followed Instagram accounts">second highest for an individual</a> and sportsperson after Ronaldo.<sup id="cite_ref-327" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-327"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>323<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His World Cup celebration post from 18 December 2022 is the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_most-liked_Instagram_posts" title="List of most-liked Instagram posts">most liked post on Instagram</a> with over 75 million likes.<sup id="cite_ref-328" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-328"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>324<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>On 20 March 2023, during a return to Buenos Aires following his World Cup victory, Messi was mobbed by hundreds of adoring fans when he and his family were out to dinner. When news spread where Messi and his family were, the restaurant was soon surrounded by locals hoping to get a glimpse of their World Cup-winning captain. Police assistance would be needed to get Messi back to his car in the early hours of the morning.<sup id="cite_ref-329" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-329"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>325<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In April 2023, Messi was featured in the 200 year old <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thrissur_Pooram" title="Thrissur Pooram">Thrissur Pooram</a> festival in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerala" title="Kerala">Kerala</a>, India.<sup id="cite_ref-330" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-330"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>326<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> During the festival, umbrellas carrying the illuminated cut outs of Messi holding the World Cup trophy were displayed on the top of caparisoned elephants during the Kudamattam ceremony.<sup id="cite_ref-331" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-331"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>327<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In December 2023, a set of shirts Messi had worn during the 2022 World Cup was sold at auction for $7.8 million.<sup id="cite_ref-332" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-332"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>328<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>During an <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong_v_Inter_Miami" title="Hong Kong v Inter Miami">exhibition match</a> on 4 February 2024 in which Inter Miami faced off against the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong_League" class="mw-redirect" title="Hong Kong League">Hong Kong League</a> players at <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong_Stadium" title="Hong Kong Stadium">Hong Kong Stadium</a>, Messi remained on the bench the entire game, causing massive backlash in Hong Kong and China as a result.<sup id="cite_ref-333" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-333"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>329<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> A Messi commercial was taken off air in those regions,<sup id="cite_ref-:10_334-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-:10-334"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>330<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> while others remained despite pressure from Chinese social-media users.<sup id="cite_ref-335" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-335"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>331<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-336" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-336"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>332<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-337" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-337"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>333<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Furthermore, the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_Football_Association" title="Chinese Football Association">Chinese Football Association</a> temporarily halted its partnership with the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentine_Football_Association" title="Argentine Football Association">Argentine Football Association</a> over the incident on 8 February.<sup id="cite_ref-338" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-338"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>334<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Wealth_and_sponsorships">Wealth and sponsorships</h3></div>
<p>Messi was the world's highest-paid footballer for five years out of six between 2009 and 2014; he was the first player to exceed the €40&nbsp;million benchmark, with earnings of €41&nbsp;million in 2013, and the €50–€60&nbsp;million points, with income of €65&nbsp;million in 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-339" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-339"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>335<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-340" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-340"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>336<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi was second on <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forbes" title="Forbes">Forbes</a></i> list of the world's highest-paid athletes, after Cristiano Ronaldo, with income of $81&nbsp;million from salary and endorsements in 2015–16.<sup id="cite_ref-341" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-341"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>337<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In 2018, he was the first player to exceed the €100&nbsp;million benchmark for a calendar year, with earnings of €126&nbsp;million ($154&nbsp;million) in combined income from salaries, bonuses and endorsements.<sup id="cite_ref-342" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-342"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>338<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> <i>Forbes</i> ranked him the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forbes%27_list_of_the_world%27s_highest-paid_athletes" class="mw-redirect" title="Forbes&#39; list of the world&#39;s highest-paid athletes">world's highest-paid athlete</a> in 2019.<sup id="cite_ref-343" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-343"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>339<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> From 2008, he was Barcelona's highest-paid player, receiving a salary that increased incrementally from €7.8&nbsp;million to €13&nbsp;million over the next five years.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013472_344-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013472-344"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>340<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-345" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-345"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>341<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013556_113-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013556-113"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>109<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Signing a new contract in 2017, he earned $667,000 per week in wages, and Barcelona paid him $60&nbsp;million as a signing on bonus.<sup id="cite_ref-Forbes2017_346-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Forbes2017-346"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>342<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His buyout clause was set at $835&nbsp;million (€700&nbsp;million).<sup id="cite_ref-Forbes2017_346-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Forbes2017-346"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>342<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In 2020, Messi became the second footballer, as well as the second athlete in a team sport, after Ronaldo, to surpass $1&nbsp;billion in earnings during their careers.<sup id="cite_ref-347" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-347"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>343<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-left" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Hinchas_de_Messi.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/Hinchas_de_Messi.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="167" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f6/Hinchas_de_Messi.jpg/500px-Hinchas_de_Messi.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="700" data-file-height="467"></a><figcaption>Messi's Argentina jersey, supplied by Adidas, was sold out worldwide during the 2022 World Cup.<sup id="cite_ref-Arg_sales_348-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Arg_sales-348"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>344<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></figcaption></figure>
<p>In addition to salary and bonuses, much of Messi's income derives from endorsements; <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SportsPro" title="SportsPro">SportsPro</a></i> has consequently cited him as one of the world's most marketable athletes every year since their research began in 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-349" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-349"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>345<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His main sponsor since 2006 is <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adidas" title="Adidas">Adidas</a>. As Barcelona's leading youth prospect, he was signed with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nike,_Inc." title="Nike, Inc.">Nike</a> since age 14, but transferred to Adidas after they successfully challenged their rival's claim to his image rights in court.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201294–97_350-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201294%E2%80%9397-350"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>346<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi established himself as their leading brand endorser;<sup id="cite_ref-50million_293-2" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-50million-293"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>289<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> from 2008, he had a long-running signature collection of Adidas F50 boots, and in 2015, became the first footballer to receive his own sub-brand of Adidas boots, the Adidas Messi.<sup id="cite_ref-351" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-351"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>347<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-352" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-352"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>348<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Since 2017, he has worn the latest version of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adidas_Nemeziz" title="Adidas Nemeziz">Adidas Nemeziz</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-353" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-353"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>349<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In 2015, a Barcelona jersey with Messi's name and number was the best-selling replica jersey worldwide.<sup id="cite_ref-354" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-354"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>350<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> At the 2022 World Cup, Adidas sold out Messi's No. 10 Argentina jersey worldwide.<sup id="cite_ref-Arg_sales_348-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Arg_sales-348"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>344<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-right" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_(36956136633).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/250px-ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_(36956136633).jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="174" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_%2836956136633%29.jpg/500px-ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_%2836956136633%29.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="1021" data-file-height="712"></a><figcaption>After <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sign_of_the_cross#Use" title="Sign of the cross">blessing himself</a>, Messi often <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goal_celebration" title="Goal celebration">celebrates a goal</a> by pointing a finger on each hand towards <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heaven" title="Heaven">the sky</a> in dedication to his late grandmother.<sup id="cite_ref-Dedication_355-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Dedication-355"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>351<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> His goal celebration features in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_(video_game_series)" title="FIFA (video game series)"><i>FIFA</i> video game series</a>.</figcaption></figure>
<p>As a commercial entity, Messi's brand has been based exclusively on his talents and achievements as a player, in contrast to arguably more glamorous players like Ronaldo and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Beckham" title="David Beckham">David Beckham</a>. At the start of his career, he thus mainly held sponsorship contracts with companies that employ sports-oriented marketing, such as Adidas, Pepsi, and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Konami" title="Konami">Konami</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Fourth_356-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Fourth-356"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>352<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-357" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-357"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>353<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> From 2010, concurrently with increased achievements as a player, his marketing appeal widened, leading to long-term endorsement deals with luxury brands <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dolce_%26_Gabbana" title="Dolce &amp; Gabbana">Dolce &amp; Gabbana</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Audemars_Piguet" title="Audemars Piguet">Audemars Piguet</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Fourth_356-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Fourth-356"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>352<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-358" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-358"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>354<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi is a global brand ambassador for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gillette_(brand)" class="mw-redirect" title="Gillette (brand)">Gillette</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_Airlines" title="Turkish Airlines">Turkish Airlines</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ooredoo" title="Ooredoo">Ooredoo</a>, and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tata_Motors" title="Tata Motors">Tata Motors</a>, among other companies.<sup id="cite_ref-359" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-359"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>355<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-360" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-360"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>356<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-361" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-361"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>357<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-362" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-362"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>358<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi was the face of Konami's video game series <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pro_Evolution_Soccer" title="Pro Evolution Soccer">Pro Evolution Soccer</a></i>, appearing on the covers of <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PES_2009" class="mw-redirect" title="PES 2009">PES 2009</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PES_2010" class="mw-redirect" title="PES 2010">PES 2010</a>,</i> <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PES_2011" class="mw-redirect" title="PES 2011">PES 2011</a></i> and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PES_2020" class="mw-redirect" title="PES 2020">PES 2020</a></i>. He subsequently signed with rival company <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/EA_Sports" title="EA Sports">EA Sports</a> to become the face of their series <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_(video_game_series)" title="FIFA (video game series)">FIFA</a></i> and appeared on consecutive covers from <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_13" title="FIFA 13">FIFA 13</a></i> to <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_16" title="FIFA 16">FIFA 16</a></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEGuinness_World_Records2014102_363-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGuinness_World_Records2014102-363"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>359<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-364" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-364"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>360<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In 2013, a Turkish Airlines advertisement starring Messi, in which he engages in a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Selfie" title="Selfie">selfie</a> competition with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kobe_Bryant" title="Kobe Bryant">Kobe Bryant</a>, was the most-watched ad on <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/YouTube" title="YouTube">YouTube</a> in 2013, receiving 137 million views, and was voted the best advertisement of the 2005–15 decade to commemorate YouTube's founding.<sup id="cite_ref-365" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-365"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>361<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-366" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-366"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>362<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In June 2021, Messi signed a five-year deal to become an ambassador for the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hard_Rock_Cafe" title="Hard Rock Cafe">Hard Rock Cafe</a> brand. He stated, "sports and music are an integral part of my life. It is an honor to be the first athlete to partner with a brand who has a history of teaming with music legends."<sup id="cite_ref-367" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-367"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>363<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In May 2022, Messi was unveiled as <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tourism_in_Saudi_Arabia" title="Tourism in Saudi Arabia">Saudi Arabia's tourism</a> ambassador. Due to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saudi_Arabia" title="Saudi Arabia">Saudi Arabia</a>'s poor human rights record, Messi was condemned for the role which was viewed as an attempt of Saudi <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sportswashing" title="Sportswashing">sportswashing</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-368" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-368"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>364<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-369" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-369"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>365<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Philanthropy">Philanthropy</h3></div>
<p>Throughout his career, Messi has been involved in charitable efforts aimed at vulnerable children, a commitment that stems in part from the medical difficulties he faced in his own childhood. Since 2004, he has contributed his time and finances to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UNICEF" title="UNICEF">United Nations Children's Fund</a> (UNICEF), an organisation with which Barcelona also have a strong association.<sup id="cite_ref-Leo_Messi:_Goodwill_Ambassador_370-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Leo_Messi:_Goodwill_Ambassador-370"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>366<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-371" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-371"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>367<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi has served as a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UNICEF_Goodwill_Ambassador" title="UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador">UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador</a> since his appointment in March 2010, completing his first field mission for the organisation four months later as he travelled to Haiti to bring public awareness to the plight of the country's children in the wake of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_Haiti_earthquake" title="2010 Haiti earthquake">2010 Haiti earthquake</a>. He has since participated in UNICEF campaigns targeting <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prevention_of_HIV/AIDS" title="Prevention of HIV/AIDS">HIV prevention</a>, education, and the social inclusion of disabled children.<sup id="cite_ref-372" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-372"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>368<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> To celebrate his son's first birthday, in November 2013, Messi and Thiago were part of a publicity campaign to raise awareness of mortality rates among disadvantaged children.<sup id="cite_ref-373" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-373"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>369<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-left" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lionel_Messi_31mar2007.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/Lionel_Messi_31mar2007.jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="257" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/83/Lionel_Messi_31mar2007.jpg/330px-Lionel_Messi_31mar2007.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/83/Lionel_Messi_31mar2007.jpg/500px-Lionel_Messi_31mar2007.jpg 2x" data-file-width="500" data-file-height="675"></a><figcaption>Messi (pictured in 2007) has worked with UNICEF since 2004 and has served as a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UNICEF_Goodwill_Ambassador" title="UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador">UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador</a> since 2010.</figcaption></figure>
<p>In addition to his work with UNICEF, Messi founded his own charitable organisation, the Leo Messi Foundation, which supports access to health care, education, and sport for children.<sup id="cite_ref-374" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-374"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>370<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> It was established in 2007 following a visit Messi paid to a hospital for terminally ill children in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boston" title="Boston">Boston</a>, an experience that resonated with him to the point that he decided to reinvest part of his earnings into society.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013576–577_375-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013576%E2%80%93577-375"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>371<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Through his foundation, Messi has awarded research grants, financed medical training, and invested in the development of medical centres and projects in Argentina, Spain, and elsewhere in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013576–577_375-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013576%E2%80%93577-375"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>371<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-376" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-376"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>372<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In addition to his own fundraising activities, such as his global "Messi and Friends" football matches, his foundation receives financial support from various companies to which he has assigned his name in endorsement agreements, with Adidas as their main sponsor.<sup id="cite_ref-377" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-377"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>373<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-378" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-378"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>374<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> A gold replica of his left foot, weighing 25&nbsp;kg (55&nbsp;lb) and valued at $5.3&nbsp;million, went on sale in Japan in 2013 to raise funds for victims of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2011_T%C5%8Dhoku_earthquake_and_tsunami" title="2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami">2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-379" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-379"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>375<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Messi has also invested in youth football in Argentina: he financially supports Sarmiento, a football club based in the Rosario neighbourhood where he was born, committing in 2013 to the refurbishment of their facilities and the installation of all-weather pitches, and funds the management of several youth players at Newell's Old Boys and rival club <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosario_Central" title="Rosario Central">Rosario Central</a>, as well as at <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Club_Atl%C3%A9tico_River_Plate" title="Club Atlético River Plate">River Plate</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boca_Juniors" title="Boca Juniors">Boca Juniors</a> in Buenos Aires.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013576–577_375-2" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagu%C3%A92013576%E2%80%93577-375"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>371<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> At Newell's Old Boys, his boyhood club, he funded the 2012 construction of a new gymnasium and a dormitory inside the club's <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Estadio_Marcelo_Bielsa" title="Estadio Marcelo Bielsa">stadium</a> for their youth academy. His former youth coach at Newell's, Ernesto Vecchio, is employed by the Leo Messi Foundation as a talent scout for young players.<sup id="cite_ref-Here_32-4" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Here-32"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On 7 June 2016, Messi won a libel case against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Raz%C3%B3n_(Madrid)" title="La Razón (Madrid)"><i>La Razón</i> newspaper</a> and was awarded €65,000 in damages, which he donated to the charity <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C3%A9decins_Sans_Fronti%C3%A8res" title="Médecins Sans Frontières">Médecins Sans Frontières</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-380" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-380"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>376<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi made a donation worth €1&nbsp;million ($1.1&nbsp;million) to fight the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic" title="COVID-19 pandemic">spread of coronavirus</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-381" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-381"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>377<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> This was split between Clinic Barcelona in Barcelona and his native Argentina.<sup id="cite_ref-382" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-382"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>378<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In addition to this, Messi along with his fellow FC Barcelona teammates announced he would be taking a 70% cut in salaries during the 2020 coronavirus emergency, and contribute further to the club to provide fully to salaries of all the clubs employees.<sup id="cite_ref-383" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-383"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>379<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In November 2016, with the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentine_Football_Association" title="Argentine Football Association">Argentine Football Association</a> being run by a FIFA committee for emergency due to an economic crisis, it was reported that three of the national team's security staff told Messi that they had not received their salaries for six months. He stepped in and paid the salaries of the three members.<sup id="cite_ref-384" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-384"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>380<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-385" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-385"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>381<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> In February 2021, Messi donated to the <span title="Catalan-language text"><span lang="ca" style="font-style: normal;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Museu_Nacional_d%27Art_de_Catalunya" title="Museu Nacional d&#39;Art de Catalunya">Museu Nacional d'Art de Catalunya</a></span></span> his Adidas shoes which he wore when he scored his 644th goal for Barcelona and broke <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pel%C3%A9" title="Pelé">Pelé</a>'s record for most goals scored for a single club; the shoes were later auctioned off in April by the museum for charity to help children with cancer and were sold for £125,000.<sup id="cite_ref-386" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-386"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>382<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In advance of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2021 Copa América">2021 Copa América</a>, Messi donated three signed shirts to the Chinese pharmaceutical firm <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinovac_Biotech" title="Sinovac Biotech">Sinovac Biotech</a> – whose directors spoke of their admiration for Messi – in order to secure 50,000 doses of Sinovac's <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_vaccine" title="COVID-19 vaccine">COVID-19 vaccine</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CoronaVac" title="CoronaVac">CoronaVac</a>, in the hope of vaccinating all of South America's football players.<sup id="cite_ref-Vac_387-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Vac-387"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>383<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> A deal brokered by Uruguay's president <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Lacalle_Pou" title="Luis Lacalle Pou">Luis Lacalle Pou</a>, the plan to prioritise football players caused some controversy given widespread vaccine scarcity in the region, with the Mayor of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canelones,_Uruguay" title="Canelones, Uruguay">Canelones</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yamand%C3%BA_Orsi" title="Yamandú Orsi">Yamandú Orsi</a> remarking that "Just as the president manifested cooperation with CONMEBOL to vaccinate for the Copa América, he could just as well have the same consideration for Canelones".<sup id="cite_ref-Vac_387-1" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-Vac-387"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>383<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>In January 2025, Messi was presented with the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidential_Medal_of_Freedom" title="Presidential Medal of Freedom">Presidential Medal of Freedom</a>, the highest civilian award of the United States, by President <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Biden" title="Joe Biden">Joe Biden</a> for his contributions in supporting healthcare and education programs for children around the world.<sup id="cite_ref-PMOF_388-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-PMOF-388"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>384<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He would be unable to attend the ceremony due to scheduling conflicts, but sent a letter expressing his appreciation for the honor and his hopes of meeting President Biden at a later date.<sup id="cite_ref-389" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-389"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>385<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Public_art">Public art</h3></div>
<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-right" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Street_art_of_Lionel_Messi_in_Barcelona_(2023).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="./Lionel Messi - Wikipedia_files/Street_art_of_Lionel_Messi_in_Barcelona_(2023).jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="253" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/Street_art_of_Lionel_Messi_in_Barcelona_%282023%29.jpg/330px-Street_art_of_Lionel_Messi_in_Barcelona_%282023%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/Street_art_of_Lionel_Messi_in_Barcelona_%282023%29.jpg/380px-Street_art_of_Lionel_Messi_in_Barcelona_%282023%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="488" data-file-height="650"></a><figcaption>One of many <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Street_art" title="Street art">street art</a> displays depicting Messi.</figcaption></figure>
<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Street_art" title="Street art">Street art</a> and public <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murals" class="mw-redirect" title="Murals">murals</a> depicting Messi are regularly painted around the world.<sup id="cite_ref-390" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-390"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>386<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-391" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-391"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>387<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> One prominent artwork that went viral is the <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sistine_Chapel_of_Football" title="Sistine Chapel of Football">Sistine Chapel of Football</a></i>, a parody of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michelangelo" title="Michelangelo">Michelangelo</a>'s <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Creation_of_Adam" title="The Creation of Adam">The Creation of Adam</a></i> that features both Messi and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a>, along with several other prominent Argentine footballers. The work is exhibited at the Sportivo Pereyra club from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barracas,_Buenos_Aires" title="Barracas, Buenos Aires">Barracas</a> in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buenos_Aires" title="Buenos Aires">Buenos Aires</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-392" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-392"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>388<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>Several public sculptures with Messi's likeness have been erected. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madame_Tussauds" title="Madame Tussauds">Madame Tussauds</a> unveiled their first wax sculpture of Messi at <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wembley_Stadium" title="Wembley Stadium">Wembley Stadium</a> in 2012.<sup id="cite_ref-393" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-393"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>389<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> After the announcement of his first retirement from the international team in June 2016, a bronze statue of Messi was erected in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buenos_Aires" title="Buenos Aires">Buenos Aires</a> days later in an attempt to convince him to return.<sup id="cite_ref-394" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-394"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>390<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> A life-sized statue of Messi holding the World Cup trophy was unveiled outside the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CONMEBOL" title="CONMEBOL">CONMEBOL</a> headquarters in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luque,_Paraguay" class="mw-redirect" title="Luque, Paraguay">Luque, Paraguay</a> in March 2023, a few months after Argentina's World Cup win. The statue would stand alongside those of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pel%C3%A9" title="Pelé">Pelé</a> and Maradona.<sup id="cite_ref-395" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-395"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>391<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Media">Media</h3></div>
<p><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messi_(2014_film)" title="Messi (2014 film)">Messi</a></i>, a documentary by filmmaker <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%81lex_de_la_Iglesia" title="Álex de la Iglesia">Álex de la Iglesia</a>, premiered at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/71st_Venice_International_Film_Festival" title="71st Venice International Film Festival">71st Venice International Film Festival</a> in August 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-396" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-396"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>392<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messi%27s_World_Cup:_The_Rise_of_a_Legend" title="Messi&#39;s World Cup: The Rise of a Legend">Messi's World Cup: The Rise of a Legend</a></i>, a biographical docuseries focusing on Messi's career, his highs and lows with the Argentina national football team, and their eventual success at the 2022 FIFA World Cup, aired on <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_TV%2B" title="Apple TV+">Apple TV+</a> on 21 February 2024.<sup id="cite_ref-397" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-397"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>393<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Business_ventures">Business ventures</h3></div>
<p>On 4 June 2024, Messi announced the release of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C3%A1s%2B" title="Más+">Más+</a>, an American brand of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sports_drink" title="Sports drink">sports</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Energy_drink" title="Energy drink">energy drinks</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-SafidDeen2024_398-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-SafidDeen2024-398"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>394<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Messi created the drink because he couldn't find a flavorful and healthy hydration option that suited his needs.<sup id="cite_ref-CNWYahoo_399-0" class="reference"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lionel_Messi#cite_note-CNWYahoo-399"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>395<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The drink was teased to debut in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miami" title="Miami">Miami</a>, Florida, on 13 June 2024.
